name: cp2k
description: Metainfo for the values parsed from a CP2K input file.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_basis_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: CP2K Basis Set Standard Format

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_basis_set
metaInfos.description: The contracted Gaussian basis set

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_basis_set_file_name
metaInfos.description: Name of the basis set file, may include a path

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_basis_type
metaInfos.description: Basis set type

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_d_exponents
metaInfos.description: Exponents for d functions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_d_quantum_numbers
metaInfos.description: Main quantum numbers for d functions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_eps_eigenvalue
metaInfos.description: Cutoff of overlap matrix eigenvalues included into basis

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_f_exponents
metaInfos.description: Exponents for f functions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_f_quantum_numbers
metaInfos.description: Main quantum numbers for f functions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_geo_start_value
metaInfos.description: Geometrical basis: starting value a in a*C^k

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_geometrical_factor
metaInfos.description: Geometrical basis: factor C in a*C^k

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_grid_points
metaInfos.description: Number of radial grid points

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_num_gto
metaInfos.description: Number of Gaussian type functions for s, p, d, ...

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_num_slater
metaInfos.description: Number of Slater type functions for s, p, d, ...

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_p_exponents
metaInfos.description: Exponents for p functions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_p_quantum_numbers
metaInfos.description: Main quantum numbers for p functions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_quadrature
metaInfos.description: Algorithm to construct the atomic radial grids

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_s_exponents
metaInfos.description: Exponents for s functions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_s_quantum_numbers
metaInfos.description: Main quantum numbers for s functions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_ae_basis_start_index
metaInfos.description: Starting index for Geometrical Basis sets

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_atomic_number
metaInfos.description: Specify the atomic number

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_calculate_states
metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of states calculated per l value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_core
metaInfos.description: Specifies the core electrons for a pseudopotential

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_coulomb_integrals
metaInfos.description: Method to calculate Coulomb integrals

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_electron_configuration
metaInfos.description: Specifies the electron configuration. Optional the multiplicity (m) and a core state [XX] can be declared

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_element
metaInfos.description: Specify the element to be calculated

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_exchange_integrals
metaInfos.description: Method to calculate Exchange integrals

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_max_angular_momentum
metaInfos.description: Specifies the largest angular momentum calculated [0-3]

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_external_vxc_file_vxc
metaInfos.description: Specifies the filename containing the external vxc

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_external_vxc_grid_tol
metaInfos.description: Tolerance in the equivalence of read-grid in ZMP method

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_method_type
metaInfos.description: Type of electronic structure method to be used

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_relativistic
metaInfos.description: Type of scalar relativistic method to be used

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_functional_model
metaInfos.description: Which model for the coupling constant integration should be used.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_functional_type
metaInfos.description: Which Hybrid functional should be used. (Has to be consistent with the definitions in XC and HF).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_lambda
metaInfos.description: The point to be used along the adiabatic curve (0 < Î» < 1)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_omega
metaInfos.description: Long-range parameter

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_density_cutoff
metaInfos.description: The cutoff on the density used by the xc calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_density_smooth_cutoff_range
metaInfos.description: Parameter for the smoothing procedure inxc calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_functional_routine
metaInfos.description: Select the code for xc calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_gradient_cutoff
metaInfos.description: The cutoff on the gradient of the density used by the xc calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_fraction
metaInfos.description: The fraction of Hartree-Fock to add to the total energy. 1.0 implies standard Hartree-Fock if used with XC_FUNCTIONAL NONE. NOTE: In a mixed potential calculation this should be set to 1.0, otherwise all parts are multiplied with this factor.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_hf_info_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_hf_info_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_hf_info_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_hf_info_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_hf_info_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_hfx_ri_eps_optimization
metaInfos.description: Accuracy of iterative RI fit

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_hfx_ri_eps_screening
metaInfos.description: Accuracy of geminal integral evaluation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_hfx_ri_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iteration in RI fit

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_interaction_potential_cutoff_radius
metaInfos.description: Determines cutoff radius for the truncated 1/r potential. Only valid when doing truncated calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_interaction_potential_omega
metaInfos.description: Parameter for short/longrange interaction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_interaction_potential_potential_type
metaInfos.description: Which interaction potential should be used (Coulomb, longrange or shortrange).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_interaction_potential_scale_coulomb
metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a coulomb potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_interaction_potential_scale_gaussian
metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a gaussian potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_interaction_potential_scale_longrange
metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a longrange potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_interaction_potential_t_c_g_data
metaInfos.description: Location of the file t_c_g.dat that contains the data for the evaluation of the truncated gamma function

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_load_balance_block_size
metaInfos.description: Determines the blocking used for the atomic quartet loops. A proper choice can speedup the calculation. The default (-1) is automatic.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_load_balance_nbins
metaInfos.description: Number of bins per process used to group atom quartets.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_load_balance_randomize
metaInfos.description: This flag controls the randomization of the bin assignment to processes. For highly ordered input structures with a bad load balance, setting this flag to TRUE might improve.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_memory_eps_storage_scaling
metaInfos.description: Scaling factor to scale eps_schwarz. Storage threshold for compression will be EPS_SCHWARZ*EPS_STORAGE_SCALING.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_memory_max_disk_space
metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of disk space [MB] used to store precomputed compressed four-center integrals. If 0, nothing is stored to disk

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_memory_max_memory
metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of memory [MB] to be consumed by the full HFX module. All temporary buffers and helper arrays are subtracted from this number. What remains will be used for storage of integrals. NOTE: This number is assumed to represent the memory available to one MPI process. When running a threaded version, cp2k automatically takes care of distributing the memory among all the threads within a process.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_memory_storage_location
metaInfos.description: Loaction where ERI's are stored if MAX_DISK_SPACE /=0 Expects a path to a directory.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_memory_treat_forces_in_core
metaInfos.description: Determines whether the derivative ERI's should be stored to RAM or not. Only meaningful when performing Ehrenfest MD. Memory usage is defined via MAX_MEMORY, i.e. the memory is shared wit the energy ERI's.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_periodic_number_of_shells
metaInfos.description: Number of shells taken into account for periodicity. By default, cp2k tries to automatically evaluate this number. This algorithm might be to conservative, resulting in some overhead. You can try to adjust this number in order to make a calculation cheaper.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_pw_hfx
metaInfos.description: Compute the Hartree-Fock energy also in the plane wave basis.The value is ignored, and intended for debugging only.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_pw_hfx_blocksize
metaInfos.description: Improve the performance of pw_hfx at the cost of some additional memory by storing the realspace representation of PW_HFX_BLOCKSIZE states.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_screening_eps_schwarz
metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_screening_eps_schwarz_forces
metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold. This will be approximately the accuracy of the forces,  and should normally be similar to EPS_SCF

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_screening_p_screen_correction_factor
metaInfos.description: Recalculates integrals on the fly if the actual density matrix is larger by a given factor than the initial one. If the factor is set to 0.0_dp, this feature is disabled.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_screening_screen_on_initial_p
metaInfos.description: Screen on an initial density matrix. For the first MD step this matrix must be provided by a Restart File.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_screening_screen_p_forces
metaInfos.description: Screens the electronic repulsion integrals for the forces using the density matrix. This results in a significant speedup for large systems, but might require a somewhat tigher EPS_SCHWARZ_FORCES.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_hf_treat_lsd_in_core
metaInfos.description: Determines how spin denisities are taken into account. If true, the beta spin density is included via a second in core call. If false, alpha and beta spins are done in one shot

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_tau_cutoff
metaInfos.description: The cutoff on tau used by the xc calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_non_local_cutoff
metaInfos.description: The cutoff of the FFT grid used in the calculation of the nonlocal vdW functional [Ry].

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_non_local_kernel_file_name
metaInfos.description: Name of the kernel data file, may include a path.vdW_kernel_table.dat is for DRSLL and LMKLL andrVV10_kernel_table.dat is for rVV10.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_non_local_parameters
metaInfos.description: Parameters b and C of the rVV10 functional

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_non_local_type
metaInfos.description: Type of functional (the corresponding kernel data file should be selected).Allows for common forms such as vdW-DF, vdW-DF2, optB88-vdW, rVV10.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_non_local_verbose_output
metaInfos.description: Extensive output for non local functionals

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_atom_coordination_numbers
metaInfos.description: Specifies the coordination number of a set of atoms for the C9 term in DFT-D3.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_atomparm
metaInfos.description: Specifies parameters for atom types (in atomic units). If not provided default parameters are used (DFT-D2).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_calculate_c9_term
metaInfos.description: Calculate C9 terms in DFT-D3 model

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_d3_scaling
metaInfos.description: XC Functional dependent scaling parameters (s6,sr6,s8) for the DFT-D3 method, if set to zero CP2K attempts to guess the xc functional from REFERENCE_FUNCTIONAL and sets the associated scaling parameter.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_d3bj_scaling
metaInfos.description: XC Functional dependent scaling parameters (s6,a1,s8,a2) for the DFT-D3(BJ) method, if set to zero CP2K attempts to guess the xc functional from REFERENCE_FUNCTIONAL and sets the associated scaling parameter.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_eps_cn
metaInfos.description: Cutoff value for coordination number function (DFT-D3 method)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_exp_pre
metaInfos.description: Prefactor in exponential damping factor (DFT-D2 potential)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_kind_coordination_numbers
metaInfos.description: Specifies the coordination number for a kind for the C9 term in DFT-D3.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_long_range_correction
metaInfos.description: Calculate a long range correction to the DFT-D3 model

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_parameter_file_name
metaInfos.description: Name of the parameter file, may include a path

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_print_dftd_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_print_dftd_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_print_dftd_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_print_dftd_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_print_dftd_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_r_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Range of potential. The cutoff will be 2 times this value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_reference_c9_term
metaInfos.description: Calculate C9 terms in DFT-D3 model using reference coordination numbers

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_reference_functional
metaInfos.description: Use parameters for this specific density functional. For available D3 and D3(BJ) parameters see: http://www.thch.uni-bonn.de/tc/downloads/DFT-D3/functionals.html, http://www.thch.uni-bonn.de/tc/downloads/DFT-D3/functionalsbj.html

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_scaling
metaInfos.description: XC Functional dependent scaling parameter, if set to zero CP2K attempts to guess the xc functional that is in use and sets the associated scaling parameter.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_type
metaInfos.description: Type of potential

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_verbose_output
metaInfos.description: Extensive output for the DFT-D2 and DFT-D3 models

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_vdw_potential_potential_type
metaInfos.description: Type of dispersion/vdW functional or potential to use

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_calc_cond_num
metaInfos.description: Calculate the condition number of the (P|Q) matrix for the RI methods.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_col_block
metaInfos.description: Size of the column block used in the SCALAPACK block cyclic data distribution.Default is (COL_BLOCK=-1) is automatic. A proper choice can speedup the parallel matrix multiplication in the case of RI-RPA and RI-SOS-MP2-Laplace.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_cphf_eps_conv
metaInfos.description: Convergence threshold for the solution of the Z-vector equations. The Z-vector equations have the form of a linear system of equations Ax=b, convergence is achieved when |Ax-b|<=EPS_CONV.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_cphf_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iterations allowed for the solution of the Z-vector equations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_direct_canonical_big_send
metaInfos.description: Send big messages between processes (useful for >48 processors).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_group_size
metaInfos.description: Group size used in the computation of the integrals. Default is to use all processors (GROUP_SIZE=-1).A smaller group size (for example the node size), might a better choice if the actual MP2 time is large compared to integral computation time. This is usually the case if the total number of processors is not too large.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_interaction_potential_potential_type
metaInfos.description: Which interaction potential should be used (Coulomb, TShPSC operator).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_interaction_potential_truncation_radius
metaInfos.description: Determines truncation radius for the truncated TShPSC potential. Only valid when doing truncated calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_interaction_potential_tshpsc_data
metaInfos.description: Location of the file TShPSC.dat that contains the data for the evaluation of the TShPSC G0

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_memory
metaInfos.description: Maximum allowed total memory usage during MP2 methods [Mb].

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_method
metaInfos.description: Which method should be used to compute the MP2 energy

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_mp2_info_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_mp2_info_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_mp2_info_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_mp2_info_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_mp2_info_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_basis_size
metaInfos.description: Specifies the size of the auxiliary basis set automatically generated as initial guess. This will be effective only if RI_AUX_BASIS_SET in the KIND section and NUM_FUNC are not specified.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_delta_i_rel
metaInfos.description: Target accuracy in the relative deviation of the amplitudes calculated with and without RI approximation, (more details in Chem.Phys.Lett.294(1998)143).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_delta_ri
metaInfos.description: Target accuracy in the absolute difference between the RI-MP2 and the exact MP2 energy, DRI=ABS(E_MP2-E_RI-MP2).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_eps_deriv
metaInfos.description: The derivatives of the MP2 energy with respect to the exponents of the basis are calculated numerically. The change in the exponent a_i employed for the numerical evaluation is defined as h_i=EPS_DERIV*a_i.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Specifies the maximum number of steps in the RI basis optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_num_func
metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of function, for each angular momentum (s, p, d ...), employed in the automatically generated initial guess. This will be effective only if RI_AUX_BASIS_SET in the KIND section is not specified.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_laplace_quadrature_points
metaInfos.description: Number of quadrature points for the numerical integration in the RI-SOS-MP2-Laplace method.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_laplace_size_integ_group
metaInfos.description: Group size for the integration in the Laplace method, that is the number of processes involved in the computation of each integration point. SIZE_INTEG_GROUP has to be a multiple of GROUP_SIZE in the WF_CORRELATION section. The default (-1) is automatic.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_mp2_block_size
metaInfos.description: Determines the blocking used for communication in RI-MP2. Larger BLOCK_SIZE reduces communication but requires more memory. The default (-1) is automatic.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_mp2_eps_canonical
metaInfos.description: Threshold for discriminate if a given ij pairs of the unrelaxed MP2 density matrix has to be calculated with a canonical reformulation based on the occupied eigenvalues differences.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_mp2_free_hfx_buffer
metaInfos.description: Free the buffer containing the 4 center integrals used in the Hartree-Fock exchange calculation. This will be effective only for gradients calculations, since for the energy only case, the buffers are released by default. (Right now debugging only).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_fraction
metaInfos.description: The fraction of Hartree-Fock to add to the total energy. 1.0 implies standard Hartree-Fock if used with XC_FUNCTIONAL NONE. NOTE: In a mixed potential calculation this should be set to 1.0, otherwise all parts are multiplied with this factor.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hf_info_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hf_info_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hf_info_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hf_info_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hf_info_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hfx_ri_eps_optimization
metaInfos.description: Accuracy of iterative RI fit

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hfx_ri_eps_screening
metaInfos.description: Accuracy of geminal integral evaluation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hfx_ri_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iteration in RI fit

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_cutoff_radius
metaInfos.description: Determines cutoff radius for the truncated 1/r potential. Only valid when doing truncated calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_omega
metaInfos.description: Parameter for short/longrange interaction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_potential_type
metaInfos.description: Which interaction potential should be used (Coulomb, longrange or shortrange).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_scale_coulomb
metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a coulomb potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_scale_gaussian
metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a gaussian potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_scale_longrange
metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a longrange potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_t_c_g_data
metaInfos.description: Location of the file t_c_g.dat that contains the data for the evaluation of the truncated gamma function

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_load_balance_block_size
metaInfos.description: Determines the blocking used for the atomic quartet loops. A proper choice can speedup the calculation. The default (-1) is automatic.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_load_balance_nbins
metaInfos.description: Number of bins per process used to group atom quartets.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_load_balance_randomize
metaInfos.description: This flag controls the randomization of the bin assignment to processes. For highly ordered input structures with a bad load balance, setting this flag to TRUE might improve.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_eps_storage_scaling
metaInfos.description: Scaling factor to scale eps_schwarz. Storage threshold for compression will be EPS_SCHWARZ*EPS_STORAGE_SCALING.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_max_disk_space
metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of disk space [MB] used to store precomputed compressed four-center integrals. If 0, nothing is stored to disk

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_max_memory
metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of memory [MB] to be consumed by the full HFX module. All temporary buffers and helper arrays are subtracted from this number. What remains will be used for storage of integrals. NOTE: This number is assumed to represent the memory available to one MPI process. When running a threaded version, cp2k automatically takes care of distributing the memory among all the threads within a process.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_storage_location
metaInfos.description: Loaction where ERI's are stored if MAX_DISK_SPACE /=0 Expects a path to a directory.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_treat_forces_in_core
metaInfos.description: Determines whether the derivative ERI's should be stored to RAM or not. Only meaningful when performing Ehrenfest MD. Memory usage is defined via MAX_MEMORY, i.e. the memory is shared wit the energy ERI's.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_periodic_number_of_shells
metaInfos.description: Number of shells taken into account for periodicity. By default, cp2k tries to automatically evaluate this number. This algorithm might be to conservative, resulting in some overhead. You can try to adjust this number in order to make a calculation cheaper.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_pw_hfx
metaInfos.description: Compute the Hartree-Fock energy also in the plane wave basis.The value is ignored, and intended for debugging only.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_pw_hfx_blocksize
metaInfos.description: Improve the performance of pw_hfx at the cost of some additional memory by storing the realspace representation of PW_HFX_BLOCKSIZE states.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_eps_schwarz
metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_eps_schwarz_forces
metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold. This will be approximately the accuracy of the forces,  and should normally be similar to EPS_SCF

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_p_screen_correction_factor
metaInfos.description: Recalculates integrals on the fly if the actual density matrix is larger by a given factor than the initial one. If the factor is set to 0.0_dp, this feature is disabled.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_screen_on_initial_p
metaInfos.description: Screen on an initial density matrix. For the first MD step this matrix must be provided by a Restart File.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_screen_p_forces
metaInfos.description: Screens the electronic repulsion integrals for the forces using the density matrix. This results in a significant speedup for large systems, but might require a somewhat tigher EPS_SCHWARZ_FORCES.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_treat_lsd_in_core
metaInfos.description: Determines how spin denisities are taken into account. If true, the beta spin density is included via a second in core call. If false, alpha and beta spins are done in one shot

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_minimax_quadrature
metaInfos.description: Use the Minimax quadrature scheme for performing the numerical integration. Maximum number of quadrature point limited to 20.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_mm_style
metaInfos.description: Matrix multiplication style for the Q matrix.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_quadrature_points
metaInfos.description: Number of quadrature points for the numerical integration in the RI-RPA method.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_size_freq_integ_group
metaInfos.description: Group size for frequency integration, that is the number of processes involved in the computation of each integration point. SIZE_FREQ_INTEG_GROUP has to be a multiple of GROUP_SIZE in the WF_CORRELATION section. The default (-1) is automatic.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_row_block
metaInfos.description: Size of the row block used in the SCALAPACK block cyclic data distribution.Default is (ROW_BLOCK=-1) is automatic. A proper choice can speedup the parallel matrix multiplication in the case of RI-RPA and RI-SOS-MP2-Laplace.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_scale_s
metaInfos.description: Scaling factor of the singlet energy component (opposite spin, OS).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_scale_t
metaInfos.description: Scaling factor of the triplet energy component (same spin, SS).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_wfc_gpw_cutoff
metaInfos.description: The cutoff of the finest grid level in the MP2 gpw integration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_wfc_gpw_eps_filter
metaInfos.description: Determines a threshold for the DBCSR based multiply (usually 10 times smaller than EPS_GRID).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_wfc_gpw_eps_grid
metaInfos.description: Determines a threshold for the GPW based integration

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_wfc_gpw_print_level
metaInfos.description: How much output is written by the individual groups.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_wf_correlation_wfc_gpw_rel_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Determines the grid at which a Gaussian is mapped.

metaInfos.description: Defines the parameter of the adiabatic curve

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_xc_functional_becke88_lr_adiabatic_omega
metaInfos.description: Potential parameter in erf(omega*r)/r

metaInfos.description: scales the exchange part of the functional

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_atom_method_xc_xc_functional_becke88_lr_adiabatic_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: activates the functional

metaInfos.description: scales the exchange part of the functional

metaInfos.description: gives the exact number of processors for each group.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_farming_group_size
metaInfos.description: Gives the preferred size of a working group, groups will always be equal or larger than this size.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_farming_job_dependencies
metaInfos.description: specifies a list of JOB_IDs on which the current job depends. The current job will not be executed before all the dependencies have finished. The keyword requires a MASTER_SLAVE farming run. Beyond the default case, some special cases might arise: 1) circular dependencies will lead to a deadlock. 2) This keyword is not compatible with CYCLE. 3) MAX_JOBS_PER_GROUP is ignored (though only a total of MAX_JOBS_PER_GROUP*NGROUPS jobs will be executed) 4) dependencies on jobs that will not be executed (due to RESTART or MAX_JOBS_PER_GROUP) are ignored. Additionally, note that, on some file systems,  output (restart) files might not be immediately available on all compute nodes,potentially resulting in unexpected failures.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_farming_job_job_id
metaInfos.description: An ID used to indentify a job in DEPENDENCIES. JOB_IDs do not need to be unique, dependencies will be on all jobs with a given ID. If no JOB_ID is given, the index of the &JOB section in the input file will be used.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_farming_job_output_file_name

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_farming_master_slave
metaInfos.description: If a master-slave setup should be employed, in which one process is used to distribute the tasks. This is most useful to load-balance if not all jobs have the same length, and a lot of CPUs/groups are availabe.

Electron delocalization can be computed using either fully delocalized MOs or spatially restricted ALMOs (called extended ALMOs or XALMOs). All methods below use a PCG optimizer controlled by XALMO_OPTIMIZER_PCG. The only exception is the non-iterative XALMO_1DIAG.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_basis_set_file_name
metaInfos.description: Name of the basis set file, may include a path

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_charge
metaInfos.description: The total charge of the system

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_gcut
metaInfos.description: Cutoff for charge fit in G-space.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_min_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the smallest radius of the gaussian used in the fit. All other radius are obtained with the progression factor.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_num_gauss
metaInfos.description: Specifies the numbers of gaussian used to fit the QM density for each atomic site.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_pfactor
metaInfos.description: Specifies the progression factor for the gaussian exponent for each atomic site.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_program_run_info_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_program_run_info_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_program_run_info_condition_number
metaInfos.description: Prints information regarding the condition numbers of the A matrix (to be inverted)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_program_run_info_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_program_run_info_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_program_run_info_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_density_fitting_radii
metaInfos.description: Specifies all the radius of the gaussian used in the fit for each atomic site. The use of this keyword disables all other keywords of this section.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_constant_env_end_step
metaInfos.description: Last step the field is applied

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_constant_env_start_step
metaInfos.description: First step the field is applied

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_envelop
metaInfos.description: Shape of the efield pulse

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_gaussian_env_sigma
metaInfos.description: Width of the gaussian

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_gaussian_env_t0
metaInfos.description: Center of the gaussian envelop (maximum of the gaussian)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_intensity
metaInfos.description: Intensity of the electric field in W*cm-2 which corresponds to a maximal amplitude in a.u. of sqrt(I/(3.50944*10^16))

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_phase
metaInfos.description: phase offset of the cosine given in multiples of pi

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_polarisation
metaInfos.description: Polarisation vector of electric field

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_ramp_env_end_step_in
metaInfos.description: Step when the field reaches the full strength

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_ramp_env_end_step_out
metaInfos.description: Step when the field disappears

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_ramp_env_start_step_in
metaInfos.description: Step when the electric field starts to be applied

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_ramp_env_start_step_out
metaInfos.description: Step when the field starts to vanish

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_efield_wavelength
metaInfos.description: Wavelength of efield field

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_excitations
metaInfos.description: If excitations should be calculated

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_density_fermi_amaldi
metaInfos.description: Add the Fermi-Amaldi contribution to the Hartree potential.It leads to a more stable convergence.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_density_file_density
metaInfos.description: Specifies the filename containing the target density in *.cube format.In the MGRID section it must be imposed NGRID 1, as it works with onlyone grid. The number of points in each direction, and the spacing mustbe previously defined choosing the plane waves cut-off in section MGRIDkeyword CUTOFF, and the cube dimention in section SUBSYS / CELL / keyword ABC

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_density_lambda
metaInfos.description: Lagrange multiplier defined in the constraint ZMP method. When starting, usesmall values when starting from scratch (around 5,10). Then gradually increasethe values depending, restarting from the previous calculation with the smallervalue. To choose the progressive values of LAMBDA look at the convergence of the eigenvalues.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_density_zmp_constraint
metaInfos.description: Specify which kind of constraint to solve the ZMP equation. The COULOMB defaultoption is more stable.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_potential_dx
metaInfos.description: Parameter used for computing the derivative with the Ridders method.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_potential_error_limit
metaInfos.description: Checks that the error in computing the derivative is not larger than the value set. In case prints a warning message.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_potential_function
metaInfos.description: Specifies the functional form in mathematical notation. Variables must be the atomic coordinates (X,Y,Z) of the grid.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_potential_parameters
metaInfos.description: Defines the parameters of the functional form

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_potential_read_from_cube
metaInfos.description: Switch for reading the external potential from file pot.cube. The values of the potential must be on the grid points of the realspace grid.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_potential_scaling_factor
metaInfos.description: A factor for scaling the the external potential that is read from file.The value of the potential at each grid point is multiplied by this factor.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_potential_static
metaInfos.description: Specifies the external potential as STATIC or time dependent. At the moment only static potentials are implemented.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_potential_units
metaInfos.description: Optionally, allows to define valid CP2K unit strings for each parameter value. It is assumed that the corresponding parameter value is specified in this unit.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_potential_values
metaInfos.description: Defines the values of parameter of the functional form

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_external_vxc_file_vxc
metaInfos.description: The *.cube filename containing the v_xc potential. This works onlywith NGRID 1 imposed in the MGRID section. The number of points in eachdirection, and the spacing must equal to those previously used in the ZMPcalculation and defined through the plane wave cut-off and the cube dimensionrespectively set in section MGRID / keyword CUTOFF, and in section SUBSYS /CELL / keyword ABC

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_geminal_file_name
metaInfos.description: Name of the geminal basis set file, may include a path

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_kg_method_coloring_method
metaInfos.description: Which algorithm to use for coloring.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_kg_method_tnadd_method
metaInfos.description: Algorithm to use for the calculation of the nonadditive kinetic energy.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_kpoints_eps_geo
metaInfos.description: Accuracy in symmetry determination.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_kpoints_full_grid
metaInfos.description: Use full non-reduced kpoint grid.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_kpoints_kpoint
metaInfos.description: Specify kpoint coordinates and weight.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_kpoints_parallel_group_size
metaInfos.description: Number of processors to be used for a single kpoint. Value=-1 (minimum number of processes). Value=0 (maximum number of processes). Value=n (exactly n processes).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_kpoints_scheme
metaInfos.description: Kpoint scheme to be used.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_kpoints_symmetry
metaInfos.description: Use symmetry to reduce the number of kpoints.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_kpoints_verbose
metaInfos.description: Verbose output information.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_kpoints_wavefunctions
metaInfos.description: Use real/complex wavefunctions if possible.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_crazy_scale
metaInfos.description: scale angles

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_crazy_use_diag
metaInfos.description: Use diagonalization (slow) or pade based calculation of matrix exponentials.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_energy_range
metaInfos.description: Select the orbitals to be localized within the given energy range.This type of selection cannot be added on top of the selection through a LIST. It reads to reals that are lower and higher boundaries of the energy range.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_eps_localization
metaInfos.description: Tolerance used in the convergence criterium of the localization methods.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_eps_occupation
metaInfos.description: Tolerance in the occupation number to select only fully occupied orbitals for the rotation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_jacobi_fallback
metaInfos.description: Use Jacobi method in case no convergence was achieved by using the crazy rotations method.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_list
metaInfos.description: Indexes of the occupied wfn to be localizedThis keyword can be repeated several times(useful if you have to specify many indexes).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_list_unoccupied
metaInfos.description: Indexes of the unoccupied states to be localized, up to now only valid in combination with GPW. This keyword has to be present if unoccupied states should be localized. This keyword can be repeated several times(useful if you have to specify many indexes).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_lochomo_restart_file_name
metaInfos.description: File name where to read the MOS fromwhich to restart the localization procedure for occupied states

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_loclumo_restart_file_name
metaInfos.description: File name where to read the MOS fromwhich to restart the localization procedure for unoccupied states

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_max_crazy_angle
metaInfos.description: Largest allowed angle for the crazy rotations algorithm (smaller is slower but more stable).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iterations used for localization methods

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_method
metaInfos.description: Method of optimization if any

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_min_or_max
metaInfos.description: Requires the maximization of the spread of the wfn

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_operator
metaInfos.description: Type of opertator which defines the spread functional

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_out_iter_each
metaInfos.description: Every how many iterations of the localization algorithm(Jacobi) the tolerance value is printed out

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_restart
metaInfos.description: Restart the localization from a set of orbitals read from a localization restart file.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the MOS localization procedure

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_states
metaInfos.description: Which states to localize, LUMO up to now only available in GPW

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_localize_use_history
metaInfos.description: Generate an improved initial guess based on a history of results, which is useful during MD.Will only work if the number of states to be localized remains constant.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_low_spin_roks_energy_scaling
metaInfos.description: The scaling factors for each term added to the total energy.This list should contain one number for each term added to the total energy.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_low_spin_roks_spin_configuration
metaInfos.description: for each singly occupied orbital, specify if this should be an alpha (=1) or a beta (=2) orbitalThis keyword should be repeated, each repetition corresponding to an additional term.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_dos_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_dos_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_dos_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_dos_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_dos_n_gridpoints
metaInfos.description: Number of points in the computed DOS

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_dos_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_n_chebyshev
metaInfos.description: Order of the polynomial expansion.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_print_specific_e_density_cube_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_print_specific_e_density_cube_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_print_specific_e_density_cube_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_print_specific_e_density_cube_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_print_specific_e_density_cube_max_energy
metaInfos.description: Upper bounds of the energy ranges of interest.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_print_specific_e_density_cube_min_energy
metaInfos.description: Lower bounds of the energy ranges of interest.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_print_specific_e_density_cube_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_chebyshev_print_specific_e_density_cube_stride
metaInfos.description: The stride (X,Y,Z) used to write the cube file (larger values result in smaller cube files). You can provide 3 numbers (for X,Y,Z) or 1 number valid for all components.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_curvy_steps_filter_factor
metaInfos.description: Allows to set a seperate EPS_FILTER in the newton iterations. The new EPS is EPS_FILTER*FILTER_FACTOR.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_curvy_steps_filter_factor_scale
metaInfos.description: Allows for dynamic EPS_FILTER. Updates the filter factor every scf-newton step by FILTER_FACTOR=FILTER_FACTOR*FILTER_FACTOR_SCALE

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_curvy_steps_line_search
metaInfos.description: Line serch type used in the curvy_setp optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_curvy_steps_min_filter
metaInfos.description: Lowest EPS_FILTER in dynamic filtering. Given as multiple of EPS_FILTER: EPS_FILTER_MIN=EPS_FILTER*MIN_FILTER

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_curvy_steps_min_hessian_shift
metaInfos.description: Minimal eigenvalue shift for the Hessian in the Newton iteration. Useful for small band gap systems (0.5-1.0 recommended).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_curvy_steps_n_bch_history
metaInfos.description: Number of stored matrices in the Baker-Campbell-Hausdorff series. Reduces the BCH evaluation during line search but can be memory intense.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_dynamic_threshold
metaInfos.description: Should the threshold for the purification be chosen dynamically

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_eps_diis
metaInfos.description: Threshold on the convergence to start using DIIS

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_eps_filter
metaInfos.description: Threshold used for filtering matrix operations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_eps_lanczos
metaInfos.description: Threshold used for lanczos estimates.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_eps_scf
metaInfos.description: target accuracy for the scf convergence. Change of the total energy per electron

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_extrapolation_order
metaInfos.description: Number of previous matrices used for the ASPC extrapolation of the initial guess. 0 implies that an atomic guess is used at each step. low (1-2) will result in a drift of the constant of motion during MD. high (>5) might be somewhat unstable, leading to more SCF iterations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_fixed_mu
metaInfos.description: Should the calculation be performed at fixed chemical potential, or should it be found fixing the number of electrons

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_ini_diis
metaInfos.description: Iteration cycle to start DIIS Kohn-Sham matrix update

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_ls_diis
metaInfos.description: Perform DIIS within linear scaling SCF

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_matrix_cluster_type
metaInfos.description: Specify how atomic blocks should be clustered in the used matrices, in order to improve flop rate, and possibly speedup the matrix multiply. Note that the atomic s_preconditioner can not be used.Furthermore, since screening is on matrix blocks, slightly more accurate results can be expected with molecular.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_max_diis
metaInfos.description: Size of LS_DIIS buffer

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_max_iter_lanczos
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of lanczos iterations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_max_scf
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of SCF iteration to be performed for one optimization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_mixing_fraction
metaInfos.description: Mixing density matrices uses the specified fraction in the SCF procedure.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_mu
metaInfos.description: Value (or initial guess) for the chemical potential, i.e. some suitable energy between HOMO and LUMO energy.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_nmixing
metaInfos.description: Minimal number of density mixing before start DIIS

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_non_monotonic
metaInfos.description: Should the purification be performed non-monotonically. Relevant for TC2 only.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_perform_mu_scan
metaInfos.description: Do a scan of the chemical potential after the SCF

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_purification_method
metaInfos.description: Scheme used to purify the Kohn-Sham matrix into the density matrix.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_report_all_sparsities
metaInfos.description: Run the sparsity report at the end of the SCF

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_restart_read
metaInfos.description: Read the density matrix before the (first) SCF.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_restart_write
metaInfos.description: Write the density matrix at the end of the SCF (currently requires EXTRAPOLATION_ORDER>0). Files might be rather large.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_s_inversion
metaInfos.description: Method used to compute the inverse of S.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_s_preconditioner
metaInfos.description: Preconditions S with some appropriate form.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_sign_sqrt_order
metaInfos.description: Order of the sqrt iteration, should be 2..5, 3 or 5 recommended

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_ls_scf_single_precision_matrices
metaInfos.description: Matrices used within the LS code can be either double or single precision.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_commensurate
metaInfos.description: If the grids should be commensurate. If true overrides the progression factor and the cutoffs of the sub grids

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_cutoff
metaInfos.description: The cutoff of the finest grid level. Default value for SE or DFTB calculation is 1.0 [Ry].

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_interpolator_aint_precond
metaInfos.description: the approximate inverse to use to get the starting point for the linear solver of the spline3 methods

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_interpolator_conv_info_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_interpolator_conv_info_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_interpolator_conv_info_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.description: accuracy on the residual for spline3 the interpolators

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_interpolator_eps_x
metaInfos.description: accuracy on the solution for spline3 the interpolators

metaInfos.description: the interpolator to use

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_interpolator_max_iter
metaInfos.description: the maximum number of iterations

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_interpolator_precond
metaInfos.description: The preconditioner used for the linear solver of the spline3 methods

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_interpolator_safe_computation
metaInfos.description: if a non unrolled calculation is to be performed in parallel

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_multigrid_cutoff
metaInfos.description: List of cutoff values to set up multigrids manually

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_multigrid_set
metaInfos.description: Activate a manual setting of the multigrids

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_ngrids
metaInfos.description: The number of multigrids to use

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_progression_factor
metaInfos.description: Factor used to find the cutoff of the multigrids that where not given explicitly

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_realspace
metaInfos.description: If both rho and rho_gspace are needed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_rel_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Determines the grid at which a Gaussian is mapped, giving the cutoff used for a gaussian with alpha=1. A value 50+-10Ry might be required for highly accurate results,  Or for simulations with a variable cell. Versions prior to 2.3 used a default of 30Ry.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_rs_grid_distribution_layout
metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of slices in the x, y and z directions.-1 specifies that any number of slices is OK.If a given distribution can not be satisfied, a replicated grid will result.Also see LOCK_DISTRIBUTION.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_rs_grid_distribution_type
metaInfos.description: Parallelization strategy.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_rs_grid_halo_reduction_factor
metaInfos.description: Can be used to reduce the halo of the distributed grid (experimental features).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_rs_grid_lock_distribution
metaInfos.description: Expert use only, only basic QS deals correctly with a non-default value.If the distribution is locked, a grid will have the same distribution asthe next finer multigrid (provided it is distributed).If unlocked, all grids can be distributed freely.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_rs_grid_max_distributed_level
metaInfos.description: If the multigrid-level of a grid is larger than the parameter, it will not be distributed in the automatic scheme.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_rs_grid_memory_factor
metaInfos.description: A grid will only be distributed if the memory usage for that grid (including halo) is smaller than a replicated grid by this parameter.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_mgrid_skip_load_balance_distributed
metaInfos.description: Skip load balancing on distributed multigrids, which might be memory intensive.If not explicitly specified, runs using more than 1024 MPI tasks will default to .TRUE.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_multiplicity
metaInfos.description: Two times the total spin plus one. Specify 3 for a triplet, 4 for a quartet, and so on. Default is 1 (singlet) for an even number and 2 (doublet) for an odd number of electrons.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_periodic_efield_intensity
metaInfos.description: Intensity of the electric field in a.u

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_periodic_efield_polarisation
metaInfos.description: Polarisation vector of electric field

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_plus_u_method
metaInfos.description: Method employed for the calculation of the DFT+U contribution

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_alpha
metaInfos.description: alpha parameter associated with Ewald (EWALD|PME|SPME). Recommended for small systems is is alpha = 3.5 / r_cut. Tuning alpha, r_cut and gmax is needed to obtain O(N**1.5) scaling for ewald.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_epsilon
metaInfos.description: tolerance of gaussians for fft interpolation (PME only)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_ewald_accuracy
metaInfos.description: Expected accuracy in the Ewald sum. This number affects only the calculation of the cutoff for the real-space term of the ewald summation (EWALD|PME|SPME) as well as the construction of the neighbor lists (if the cutoff for non-bonded terms is smaller than the value employed to compute the EWALD real-space term). This keyword has no effect on the reciprocal space term (which can be tuned independently).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_ewald_type
metaInfos.description: The type of ewald you want to perform.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_gmax
metaInfos.description: number of grid points (SPME and EWALD). If a single number is specified,the same number of points is used for all three directions on the grid.If three numbers are given, each direction can have a different number of points.The number of points needs to be FFTable (which depends on the library used) and odd for EWALD.The optimal number depends e.g. on alpha and the size of the cell. 1 point per Angstrom is common.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_multipoles_eps_pol
metaInfos.description: Specify the rmsd threshold for the derivatives of the energy towards the Cartesian dipoles components

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_multipoles_max_ipol_iter
metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum number of iterations for induced dipoles

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_multipoles_max_multipole_expansion
metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum level of multipoles expansion used  for the electrostatics.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_multipoles_pol_scf
metaInfos.description: Specify the method to obtain self consistent induced multipole moments.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_multipoles_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Controls the activation of the Multipoles

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_ns_max
metaInfos.description: number of grid points on small mesh (PME only), should be odd.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_o_spline
metaInfos.description: order of the beta-Euler spline (SPME only)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_rcut
metaInfos.description: Explicitly provide the real-space cutoff of the ewald summation (EWALD|PME|SPME). If present, overwrites the estimate of EWALD_ACCURACY and may affect the construction of the neighbor lists for non-bonded terms (in FIST), if the value specified is larger than the cutoff for non-bonded interactions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_distribution_layout
metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of slices in the x, y and z directions.-1 specifies that any number of slices is OK.If a given distribution can not be satisfied, a replicated grid will result.Also see LOCK_DISTRIBUTION.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_distribution_type
metaInfos.description: Parallelization strategy.

metaInfos.description: Can be used to reduce the halo of the distributed grid (experimental features).

metaInfos.description: Expert use only, only basic QS deals correctly with a non-default value.If the distribution is locked, a grid will have the same distribution asthe next finer multigrid (provided it is distributed).If unlocked, all grids can be distributed freely.

metaInfos.description: If the multigrid-level of a grid is larger than the parameter, it will not be distributed in the automatic scheme.

metaInfos.description: Convergence parameter ALPHA*RMIN. Default value 7.0

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_poisson_mt_rel_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Specify the multiplicative factor for the CUTOFF keyword in MULTI_GRID  section. The result gives the cutoff at which the 1/r non-periodic FFT3D is evaluated.Default is 2.0

metaInfos.description: Evaluates the Gterm in the Ewald Scheme analytically instead of using Splines.

metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.
