metaInfos.description: Define parameter file for atom pair

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_dftb_parameter_uff_force_field
metaInfos.description: Name of file with UFF parameters that will be used for the dispersion correction. Needs to be specified when DISPERSION==.TRUE., otherwise cp2k crashes with a Segmentation Fault.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_dftb_self_consistent
metaInfos.description: Use self-consistent method

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_distribution_2d_molecular_distribution
metaInfos.description: Distribute the atoms so that atoms belonging to a given molecule are on the same CPU for the 2D distribution. This might give rise to a worse distribution but reduces memory needs of finding the optimal distribution.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_distribution_basic_optimization
metaInfos.description: Creates a distribution based on a few heuristics using only minimal memory and CPU time.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_distribution_basic_spatial_optimization
metaInfos.description: Creates a distribution with spatial info, using only minimal memory and CPU time.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_distribution_cost_model
metaInfos.description: The cost model that needs to be minimized

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_distribution_skip_optimization
metaInfos.description: Do not optimize the distribution, go for something very simple. Might be useful if the optimization, which scales quadratically in system size, is too expensive.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_distribution_symmetric
metaInfos.description: Take the symmetry of the distribution_2d into account.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_core_charge
metaInfos.description: Precision for mapping the core charges.Overrides EPS_DEFAULT/100.0 value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_cpc
metaInfos.description: Sets precision of the GAPW projection. Overrides EPS_DEFAULT value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_default
metaInfos.description: Try setting all EPS_xxx to values leading to an energy correct up to EPS_DEFAULT

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_filter_matrix
metaInfos.description: Sets the threshold for filtering matrix elements.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_gvg_rspace
metaInfos.description: Sets precision of the realspace KS matrix element integration. Overrides SQRT(EPS_DEFAULT) value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_kg_orb
metaInfos.description: Sets precision used in coloring the subsets for the Kim-Gordon method. Overrides SQRT(EPS_DEFAULT) value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_pgf_orb
metaInfos.description: Sets precision of the overlap matrix elements. Overrides SQRT(EPS_DEFAULT) value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_ppl
metaInfos.description: Adjusts the precision for the local part of the pseudo potential.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_ppnl
metaInfos.description: Sets precision of the non-local part of the pseudo potential. Overrides sqrt(EPS_DEFAULT) value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_rho
metaInfos.description: Sets precision of the density mapping on the grids.Overrides EPS_DEFAULT value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_rho_gspace
metaInfos.description: Sets precision of the density mapping in gspace.Overrides EPS_DEFAULT value..Overrides EPS_RHO value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_eps_rho_rspace
metaInfos.description: Sets precision of the density mapping in rspace.Overrides EPS_DEFAULT value..Overrides EPS_RHO value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_epsfit
metaInfos.description: GAPW: precision to give the extention of a hard gaussian

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_epsiso
metaInfos.description: GAPW: precision to determine an isolated projector

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_epsrho0
metaInfos.description: GAPW : precision to determine the range of V(rho0-rho0soft)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_epssvd
metaInfos.description: GAPW: tolerance used in the singular value decomposition of the projector matrix

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_extrapolation
metaInfos.description: Extrapolation strategy for the wavefunction during e.g. MD.PS and ASPC are recommended, see also EXTRAPOLATION_ORDER.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_extrapolation_order
metaInfos.description: Order for the PS or ASPC extrapolation (typically 2-4). Higher order might bring more accuracy, but comes, for large systems, also at some cost. In some cases, a high order extrapolation is not stable, and the order needs to be reduced.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_force_paw
metaInfos.description: Use the GAPW scheme also for atoms with soft basis sets, i.e.  the local densities are computed even if hard and soft should be equal. If this keyword is not set to true, those atoms with soft basis sets are treated by a GPW scheme, i.e. the corresponding density contribution goes on the global grid and is expanded in PW.  This option nullifies the effect of the GPW_TYPE in the atomic KIND

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_harris_activate
metaInfos.description: Activates the harris functional.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_harris_harris_energy
metaInfos.description: Overrides the QS Energy.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_kg_method
metaInfos.description: Use a Kim-Gordon-like scheme.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_laddn0
metaInfos.description: GAPW : integer added to the max L of the basis set, used to determine the maximum value of L for the compensation charge density.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_lmaxn0
metaInfos.description: GAPW : max L number for the expansion compensation densities in spherical gaussians

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_lmaxn1
metaInfos.description: GAPW : max L number for expansion of the atomic densities in spherical gaussians

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_ls_scf
metaInfos.description: Perform a linear scaling SCF

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_map_consistent
metaInfos.description: Compute the exact derivative (Hks) of the energy with respect to the density matrix. This is slightly more expensive than using an approximate computation, but consistent mapping can improve the stability of the SCF procedure, especially for a tight EPS_SCF and a less tight EPS_DEFAULT.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_max_rad_local
metaInfos.description: GAPW : maximum radius of gaussian functions included in the generation of projectors

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_method
metaInfos.description: Specifies the electronic structure method that should be employed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_mulliken_restraint_atoms
metaInfos.description: Specifies the list of atoms that is summed in the restraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_mulliken_restraint_strength
metaInfos.description: force constant of the restraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_mulliken_restraint_target
metaInfos.description: target value of the restraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_optimize_lri_basis_accuracy
metaInfos.description: Target accuracy for the objective function (RHOEND)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_optimize_lri_basis_condition_weight
metaInfos.description: This keyword allows to give different weight factors to the condition number (LOG(cond) is used).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_optimize_lri_basis_constrain_exponents_fermi_exp
metaInfos.description: Exponent in the fermi-like constraint function.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_optimize_lri_basis_constrain_exponents_scale
metaInfos.description: Defines the upper and lower boundaries as (1+scale)*exp and (1-scale)*exp. Fermi-like constraint function

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_optimize_lri_basis_degrees_of_freedom
metaInfos.description: Specifies the degrees of freedom in the basis optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_optimize_lri_basis_geometric_sequence
metaInfos.description: Exponents are assumed to be a geometric squence. Only the minimal and maximal exponents of one set are optimized and the other exponents are obtained by geometric progression.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_optimize_lri_basis_max_fun
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of function evaluations

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_optimize_lri_basis_step_size
metaInfos.description: Initial step size for search algorithm (RHOBEG)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_optimize_lri_basis_use_condition_number
metaInfos.description: Determines whether condition number should be part of optimization or not

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_pw_grid
metaInfos.description: What kind of PW_GRID should be employed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_pw_grid_blocked
metaInfos.description: Can be used to set the distribution in g-space for the pw grids and their FFT.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_pw_grid_layout
metaInfos.description: Force a particular real-space layout for the plane waves grids. Numbers â¤ 0 mean that this dimension is free, incorrect layouts will be ignored. The default (/-1,-1/) causes CP2K to select a good value, i.e. plane distributed for large grids, more general distribution for small grids.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_quadrature
metaInfos.description: GAPW: algorithm to construct the atomic radial grids

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_s2_restraint_functional_form
metaInfos.description: Specifies the functional form of the term added

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_s2_restraint_strength
metaInfos.description: force constant of the restraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_s2_restraint_target
metaInfos.description: target value of the restraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scp
metaInfos.description: Introduce additional self-consistent polarization through additional response basis functions (read in through AUX_BASIS.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_coordination_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Define cutoff for coordination number calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_d3_scaling
metaInfos.description: Scaling parameters (s6,sr6,s8) for the D3 dispersion method,

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_dispersion
metaInfos.description: Use dispersion correction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_dispersion_parameter_file
metaInfos.description: Specify file that contains the atomic dispersion parameters

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_dispersion_radius
metaInfos.description: Define radius of dispersion interaction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_do_ewald
metaInfos.description: Use Ewald type method instead of direct sum for Coulomb interaction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_do_scc
metaInfos.description: Use self consistent charge method. Can be used together with DO_SCP to get TB method

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_do_scp
metaInfos.description: Use SCP method. Can be used to switch off SCP to get a SCC-DFTB method

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_pair_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Define cutoff for pair potential calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_parameter_file_name
metaInfos.description: Specify file that contains the atomic parameters

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_scptb_sto_ng
metaInfos.description: Provides the order of the Slater orbital expansion of Gaussian-Type Orbitals.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_analytical_gradients
metaInfos.description: Nuclear Gradients are computed analytically or numerically

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_coordination_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Define cutoff for coordination number calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_coulomb_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Atomic Cutoff Radius Cutoff for the evaluation of the  Coulomb integrals. For non-periodic calculation the default value is exactly the full cell dimension, in order to evaluate all pair interactions. Instead, for periodic calculations the default numerical value is used.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_coulomb_rc_range
metaInfos.description: Range of cutoff switch function (tapering): 0.5*(1-TANH((r-r0)/RC_RANGE)), where r0=2.0*RC_TAPER-20.0*RC_RANGE.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_coulomb_rc_taper
metaInfos.description: Atomic Cutoff Radius Cutoff for Tapering Coulomb integrals. If not specified it assumes the same value specified for the CUTOFF.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_d3_scaling
metaInfos.description: Scaling parameters (s6,sr6,s8) for the D3 dispersion method,

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_delta
metaInfos.description: Step size in finite difference force calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_dispersion
metaInfos.description: Use dispersion correction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_dispersion_parameter_file
metaInfos.description: Specify file that contains the atomic dispersion parameters

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_dispersion_radius
metaInfos.description: Define radius of dispersion interaction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_exchange_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Atomic Cutoff Radius Cutoff for the evaluation of the Exchange integrals. For non-periodic calculation the default value is exactly the full cell dimension, in order to evaluate all pair interactions. Instead, for periodic calculations the default is the minimum value between 1/4 of the cell dimension and the value specified in input (either explicitly defined or the default numerical value).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_exchange_rc_range
metaInfos.description: Range of cutoff switch function (tapering): 0.5*(1-TANH((r-r0)/RC_RANGE)), where r0=2.0*RC_TAPER-20.0*RC_RANGE.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_exchange_rc_taper
metaInfos.description: Atomic Cutoff Radius Cutoff for Tapering Exchange integrals. If not specified it assumes the same value specified for the CUTOFF.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_force_kdso_d_exchange
metaInfos.description: This keywords forces the usage of the KDSO-D integral screening for the Exchange integrals (default is to apply the screening only to the Coulomb integrals.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_ga_ncells
metaInfos.description: Defines the number of linked cells for the neighbor list. Default value is number of processors

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_integral_screening
metaInfos.description: Specifies the functional form for the

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_lr_correction_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Atomic Cutoff Radius Cutoff for the evaluation of the long-ranbe correction integrals.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_lr_correction_rc_range
metaInfos.description: Range of cutoff switch function (tapering): 0.5*(1-TANH((r-r0)/RC_RANGE)), where r0=2.0*RC_TAPER-20.0*RC_RANGE.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_lr_correction_rc_taper
metaInfos.description: Atomic Cutoff Radius Cutoff for Tapering the long-range correction integrals. If not specified it assumes the same value specified for the CUTOFF.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_memory_compress
metaInfos.description: Enables the compression of the integrals in memory.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_memory_eps_storage
metaInfos.description: Storage threshold for compression is EPS_STORAGE

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_memory_max_memory
metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of memory [MB] used to store precomputed (possibly compressed) two-electron two-center integrals

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_neighbor_lists_geo_check
metaInfos.description: This keyword enables the check that two atoms are never below the minimum value used to construct the splines during the construction of the neighbouring list. Disabling this keyword avoids CP2K to abort in case two atoms are below the minimum  value of the radius used to generate the splines.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_neighbor_lists_neighbor_lists_from_scratch
metaInfos.description: This keyword enables the building of the neighbouring list from scratch.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_neighbor_lists_verlet_skin
metaInfos.description: Defines the Verlet Skin for the generation of the neighbor lists

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_orthogonal_basis
metaInfos.description: Assume orthogonal basis set. This flag is overwritten by methods with fixed orthogonal/non-orthogonal basis set.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_periodic
metaInfos.description: Specifies the type of treatment for the electrostatic long-range part in semi-empirical calculations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_scp
metaInfos.description: Perform a SCP-NDDO calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_screening_rc_range
metaInfos.description: Range of cutoff switch function (tapering): 0.5*(1-TANH((r-r0)/RC_RANGE)), where r0=2*RC_TAPER-20*RC_RANGE.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_screening_rc_taper
metaInfos.description: Atomic Cutoff Radius Cutoff for Tapering the screening term.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_se_sto_ng
metaInfos.description: Provides the order of the Slater orbital expansion of Gaussian-Type Orbitals.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_qs_transport
metaInfos.description: Perform transport calculations (coupling CP2K and OMEN)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_accuracy_refinement
metaInfos.description: If using density propagation some parts should be calculated with a higher accuracy than the rest to reduce numerical noise. This factor determines by how much the filtering threshold is reduced for these calculations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_apply_delta_pulse
metaInfos.description: Applies a delta kick to the initial wfn (only RTP for now - the EMD  case is not yet implemented).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_aspc_order
metaInfos.description: Speciefies how many steps will be used for extrapolation. One will be always used which is means X(t+dt)=X(t)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_calculate_idempotency
metaInfos.description: Calculates the idempotency. Costs some performance. Is for free if McWeeny is used

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_delta_pulse_direction
metaInfos.description: Direction of the applied electric field. The k vector is given as 2*Pi*[i,j,k]*inv(h_mat), which for PERIODIC .FALSE. yields exp(ikr) periodic with the unit cell, only if DELTA_PULSE_SCALE is set to unity. For an orthorhombic cell [1,0,0] yields [2*Pi/L_x,0,0]. For small cells, this results in a very large kick.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_delta_pulse_scale
metaInfos.description: Scale the k vector, which for PERIODIC .FALSE. results in exp(ikr) no longer being periodic with the unit cell. The norm of k is the strength of the applied electric field in atomic units.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_density_propagation
metaInfos.description: The density matrix is propagated instead of the molecular orbitals. This allows for a linear scaling simulation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_eps_iter
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium for the self consistent propagator loop.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_exp_accuracy
metaInfos.description: Accuracy for the taylor and pade approximation. This is only an upper bound bound since the norm used for the guess is an upper bound for the needed one.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_hfx_balance_in_core
metaInfos.description: If HFX is used, this keyword forces a redistribution/recalculation of the integrals, balanced with respect to the in core steps.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_initial_wfn
metaInfos.description: Controls the initial WFN used for propagation.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_mat_exp
metaInfos.description: Which method should be used to calculate the exponential in the propagator. For Ehrenfest MD only the Taylor method works, for real time propagation diagonalization works as well.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximal number of iterations for the self consistent propagator loop.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_mcweeny_eps
metaInfos.description: Threshold after which McWeeny is terminated

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_mcweeny_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Determines the maximum amount of McWeeny steps used after each converged step in density propagation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_orthonormal
metaInfos.description: Performs rtp in the orthonormal basis, currently only works with density propagation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_periodic
metaInfos.description: Apply a delta-kick that is compatible with periodic boundary conditions for any value of DELTA_PULSE_SCALE. Uses perturbation theory for the preparation of the initial wfn. Note that the pulse is only applied when INITIAL_WFN is set to SCF_WFN, and not for restarts (RT_RESTART).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_propagator
metaInfos.description: Which propagator should be used for the orbitals

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_sc_check_start
metaInfos.description: Speciefies how many iteration steps will be done without a check for self consistency. Can save some time in big calculations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_real_time_propagation_write_restart
metaInfos.description: For density propagation. It writes out the density matrix after each step

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_relativistic_dkh_order
metaInfos.description: The order of the DKH transformation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_relativistic_method
metaInfos.description: type of relativistic correction used

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_relativistic_potential
metaInfos.description: External potential used in DKH transformation, full 1/r or erfc(r)/r

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_relativistic_transformation
metaInfos.description: Type of DKH transformation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_relativistic_z_cutoff
metaInfos.description: The minimal atomic number considered for atom transformation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_relativistic_zora_type
metaInfos.description: Type of ZORA method to be used

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_relax_multiplicity
metaInfos.description: Do not enforce the occupation of alpha and beta MOs due to the initially defined multiplicity, but rather follow an Aufbau principle. A threshold value greater than zero activates this option. Larger threshold values increase the probability for a spin flip. This option is only valid for unrestricted (i.e. spin polarised) Kohn-Sham (UKS) calculations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_roks
metaInfos.description: Requests a restricted open Kohn-Sham calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_alpha
metaInfos.description: Solvent specific tunable parameter for the calculation of the repulsion term Grep = Î± S where S is the (quantum) surface of the cavity

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_andreussi_rho_max
metaInfos.description: Maximum density value used for the smoothing of the dielectric function

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_andreussi_rho_min
metaInfos.description: Minimum density value used for the smoothing of the dielectric function

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_beta
metaInfos.description: Solvent specific tunable parameter for the calculation of the dispersion term Gdis = Î² V where V is the (quantum) volume of the cavity

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_delta_rho
metaInfos.description: Numerical increment for the calculation of the (quantum) surface of the solute cavity

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_derivative_method
metaInfos.description: Method for the calculation of the numerical derivatives on the real-space grids

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_dielectric_constant
metaInfos.description: Dielectric constant of the solvent

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_eps_sccs
metaInfos.description: Tolerance for the convergence of the polarisation density, i.e. requested accuracy for the SCCS iteration cycle

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_eps_scf
metaInfos.description: The SCCS iteration cycle is activated only if the SCF iteration cycle is converged to this threshold value

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_fattebert_gygi_beta
metaInfos.description: Parameter Î² changes the width of the interface solute-solvent

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_fattebert_gygi_rho_zero
metaInfos.description: Parameter Ï<sub>0</sub> defines the critical density in the middle of the interface solute-solvent

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_gamma
metaInfos.description: Surface tension of the solvent used for the calculation of the cavitation term Gcav = Î³ S where S is the (quantum) surface of the cavity

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of SCCS iteration steps performed to converge within the given tolerance

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_method
metaInfos.description: Method used for the smoothing of the dielectric function

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_mixing
metaInfos.description: Mixing parameter (Hartree damping) employed during the iteration procedure

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sccs_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Controls the activation of the SCCS section

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_added_mos
metaInfos.description: Number of additional MOS added for each spin

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_cholesky
metaInfos.description: If the cholesky method should be used for computing the inverse of S, and in this case calling which Lapack routines

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_algorithm
metaInfos.description: Algorithm to be used for diagonalization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_davidson_conv_mos_percent
metaInfos.description: Minimal percent of MOS that have to converge within the Davidson loop before the SCF iteration is completed and a new Hamiltonian is computed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_davidson_energy_gap
metaInfos.description: Should be an estimate for the energy gap [a.u.] (HOMO-LUMO) and is used in preconditioning, especially effective with the FULL_ALL preconditioner, in which case it should be an underestimate of the gap (0.001 doing normally fine). For the other preconditioners, making this value larger (0.2) will tame the preconditioner in case of poor initial guesses.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_davidson_first_prec
metaInfos.description: First SCF iteration at which a Preconditioner is employed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_davidson_new_prec_each
metaInfos.description: Number of SCF iterations after which a new Preconditioner is computed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_davidson_precond_solver
metaInfos.description: How the preconditioner is applied to the residual.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_davidson_preconditioner
metaInfos.description: Type of preconditioner to be used with all minimization schemes.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_davidson_sparse_mos
metaInfos.description: Use MOS as sparse matrix and avoid as much as possible multiplications with full matrices

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_eps_adapt_scf
metaInfos.description: Required density matrix accuracy as compared to current SCF convergence

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_eps_ene
metaInfos.description: Required energy accuracy for convergence of subspace diagonalization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_eps_skip_sub_diag
metaInfos.description: Level of convergence to be reached before starting the internal loop of subspace rotations. Above this threshold only the outer diagonalization method is used.  If negative the subspace rotation is started at the first iteration

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iterations for the SCF inner loop

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_alpha
metaInfos.description: Fraction of new density to be included

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_beta
metaInfos.description: Denominator parameter in Kerker damping introduced to suppress charge sloshing: rho_mix(g) =rho_in(g) + alpha*g^2/(g^2 + beta^2)*(rho_out(g)-rho_in(g))

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_broy_w0
metaInfos.description: w0 parameter used in Broyden mixing

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_broy_wmax
metaInfos.description: Settings for BROY_WMAX

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_broy_wref
metaInfos.description: Settings for BROY_WREF

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_max_gvec_exp
metaInfos.description: Restricts the G-space mixing to lower part of G-vector spectrum, up to a G0, by assigning the exponent of the Gaussian that can be represented by vectors smaller than G0 within a certain accuracy.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_max_step
metaInfos.description: Upper bound for the magnitude of the unpredicted step size in the update by the multisecant mixing scheme

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_method
metaInfos.description: Mixing method to be applied

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_n_simple_mix
metaInfos.description: Number of kerker damping iterations before starting other mixing procedures

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_nbuffer
metaInfos.description: Number of previous steps stored for the actual mixing scheme

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_nmixing
metaInfos.description: Minimal number of density mixing (should be greater than 0),before starting DIIS

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_nskip
metaInfos.description: Number of initial iteration for which the mixing is skipped

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_pulay_alpha
metaInfos.description: Fraction of new density to be added to the Pulay expansion

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_pulay_beta
metaInfos.description: Fraction of residual contribution to be added to Pulay expansion

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_r_factor
metaInfos.description: Control factor for the magnitude of the unpredicted step size in the update by the multisecant mixing scheme

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_regularization
metaInfos.description: Regularization parameter to stabilize the inversion of the residual matrix {Yn^t Yn} in the multisecant mixing scheme (noise)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_mixing_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Controls the activation of the mixing procedure

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_diag_sub_scf_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: controls the activation of inner SCF loop to refine occupations in MOS subspace

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_eps_adapt
metaInfos.description: Required accuracy in iterative diagonalization as compared to current SCF convergence

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_eps_iter
metaInfos.description: Required accuracy in iterative diagonalization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_eps_jacobi
metaInfos.description: Below this threshold value for the SCF convergence the pseudo-diagonalization method using Jacobi rotations is activated. This method is much faster than a real diagonalization and it is even speeding up while achieving full convergence.However, it needs a pre-converged wavefunction obtained by at least one real diagonalization which is further optimized while keeping the original eigenvalue spectrum. The MO eigenvalues are NOT updated. The method might be useful to speed up calculations for large systems e.g. using a semi-empirical method.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_jacobi_threshold
metaInfos.description: Controls the accuracy of the pseudo-diagonalization method using Jacobi rotations

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_krylov_check_mos_conv
metaInfos.description: This requires to check the convergence of MOS also when standard diagonalization steps are performed, if the block krylov approach is active.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_krylov_eps_krylov
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterion for the MOs

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_krylov_eps_std_diag
metaInfos.description: Level of convergence to be reached before starting the Lanczos procedure. Above this threshold a standard diagonalization method is used.  If negative Lanczos is started at the first iteration

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_krylov_nblock
metaInfos.description: Size of the block of vectors refined simultaneously by the Lanczos procedure

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_krylov_nkrylov
metaInfos.description: Dimension of the Krylov space used for the Lanczos refinement

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iterations in iterative diagonalization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_algorithm
metaInfos.description: Algorithm to be used for OT

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_broyden_adaptive_sigma
metaInfos.description: Enable adaptive curvature estimation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_broyden_beta
metaInfos.description: Underrelaxation for the broyden mixer

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_broyden_enable_flip
metaInfos.description: Ensure positive definite update

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_broyden_eta
metaInfos.description: Dampening of estimated energy curvature.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_broyden_forget_history
metaInfos.description: Forget history on bad approximation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_broyden_gamma
metaInfos.description: Backtracking parameter

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_broyden_omega
metaInfos.description: Growth limit of curvature.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_broyden_sigma
metaInfos.description: Curvature of energy functional.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_broyden_sigma_decrease
metaInfos.description: Reduction of curvature on bad approximation.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_broyden_sigma_min
metaInfos.description: Minimum adaptive curvature.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_energies
metaInfos.description: Optimize orbital energies for use in Fermi-Dirac smearing (requires ROTATION and FD smearing to be active).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_energy_gap
metaInfos.description: Should be an estimate for the energy gap [a.u.] (HOMO-LUMO) and is used in preconditioning, especially effective with the FULL_ALL preconditioner, in which case it should be an underestimate of the gap (can be a small number, e.g. 0.002). FULL_SINGLE_INVERSE takes it as lower bound (values below 0.05 can cause stability issues). In general, heigher values will tame the preconditioner in case of poor initial guesses. A negative value will leave the choice to CP2K depending on type of preconditioner.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_eps_irac
metaInfos.description: Targeted accuracy during the refinement iteration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_eps_irac_filter_matrix
metaInfos.description: Sets the threshold for filtering the matrices.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_eps_irac_quick_exit
metaInfos.description: Only one extra refinement iteration is done when the norm is below this value.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_eps_irac_switch
metaInfos.description: The algorithm switches to the polynomial refinement when the norm is below this value.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_eps_taylor
metaInfos.description: Target accuracy of the taylor expansion for the matrix functions, should normally be kept as is.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_gold_target
metaInfos.description: Target relative uncertainty in the location of the minimum for LINESEARCH GOLD

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_irac_degree
metaInfos.description: The refinement polynomial degree (2, 3 or 4).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_linesearch
metaInfos.description: 1D line search algorithm to be used with the OT minimizer, in increasing order of robustness and cost. MINIMIZER CG combined with LINESEARCH GOLD should always find an electronic minimum.  Whereas the 2PNT minimizer is almost always OK, 3PNT might be needed for systems in which successive OT CG steps do not decrease the total energy.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_max_irac
metaInfos.description: Maximum allowed refinement iteration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_max_taylor
metaInfos.description: Maximum order of the Taylor expansion before diagonalisation is prefered, for large parallel runs a slightly higher order could sometimes result in a small speedup.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_minimizer
metaInfos.description: Minimizer to be used with the OT method

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_mixed_precision
metaInfos.description: Uses a mixed precision algorithm.With a well behaved basis set (i.e. condition number less than 1/eps_sp)it provides double precision accuracy results and up to a 2 fold speedup for building and applying the preconditioner.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_n_history_vec
metaInfos.description: Number of history vectors to be used with DIIS or BROYDEN

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_nondiag_energy
metaInfos.description: Add a non-diagonal energy penalty (FD smearing)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_nondiag_energy_strength
metaInfos.description: The prefactor for the non-diagonal energy penalty (FD smearing)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_occupation_preconditioner
metaInfos.description: Preconditioner with the occupation numbers (FD smearing)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_on_the_fly_loc
metaInfos.description: On the fly localization of the molecular orbitals. Can only be used with OT/IRAC.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_ortho_irac
metaInfos.description: The orthogonality method.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_precond_solver
metaInfos.description: How the preconditioner is applied to the residual.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_preconditioner
metaInfos.description: Type of preconditioner to be used with all minimization schemes. They differ in effectiveness, cost of construction, cost of application. Properly preconditioned minimization can be orders of magnitude faster than doing nothing.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_rotation
metaInfos.description: Introduce additional variables so that rotations of the occupied subspace are allowed as well, only needed for cases where the energy is not invariant under  a rotation of the occupied subspace such as non-singlet restricted calculations  or fractional occupations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_safe_diis
metaInfos.description: Reject DIIS steps if they point away from the minimum, do SD in that case.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_scp_nddo
metaInfos.description: Introduce additional self-consistent polarization through response basis set = orbital basis set for NDDO.)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the ot method

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_ot_stepsize
metaInfos.description: Initial stepsize used for the line search, sometimes this parameter can be reduced to stablize DIIS or to improve the CG behavior in the first few steps. The optimal value depends on the quality of the preconditioner. A negative values leaves the choice to CP2K depending on the preconditioner.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_diagonalization_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the diagonalization method

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_eps_diis
metaInfos.description: Threshold on the convergence to start using DIAG/DIIS

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_eps_eigval
metaInfos.description: Throw away linear combinations of basis functions with a small eigenvalue in S

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_eps_lumo
metaInfos.description: target accuracy of the computation of the lumo energy

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_eps_scf
metaInfos.description: target accuracy for the scf convergence

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_eps_scf_history
metaInfos.description: target accuracy for the scf convergence after the history pipeline is filled

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_level_shift
metaInfos.description: Use level shifting to improve convergence

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_max_diis
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of DIIS vectors to be used

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_max_iter_lumo
metaInfos.description: The maximum number of iteration for the lumo computation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_max_scf_history
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of SCF iterations after the history pipeline is filled
