metaInfos.description: Specifies the charge for the added source of QM/MM potential

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_buffer_non_adaptive_link_add_mm_charge_corr_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the correction radius used for the QM/MM electrostatic coupling for the added source

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_buffer_non_adaptive_link_add_mm_charge_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the radius used for the QM/MM electrostatic coupling for the added source

metaInfos.description: Specifies the scaling factor to be used for projecting the forces on the capping hydrogen in the IMOMM QM/MM link scheme to the MM atom of the link. A good guess can be derived from the bond distances of the forcefield: alpha = r_eq(QM-MM) / r_eq(QM-H).

metaInfos.description: Overwrite the specification of the correction radius only for the MM atom involved in the link.Default is to use the same correction radius as for the specified type.

metaInfos.description: Specifies the index of the MM atom involved in the QM/MM link to be moved

metaInfos.description: Specifies the index of the second atom defining the direction along which  the atom will be moved

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_buffer_non_adaptive_link_move_mm_charge_corr_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the correction radius used for the QM/MM electrostatic coupling after movement

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_buffer_non_adaptive_link_move_mm_charge_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the radius used for the QM/MM electrostatic coupling after movement

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_buffer_non_adaptive_link_qm_index
metaInfos.description: Specifies the index of the QM atom involved in the QM/MM link

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_buffer_non_adaptive_link_qm_kind
metaInfos.description: Specifies the element of the QM capping atom involved in the QM/MM link

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_buffer_non_adaptive_qm_kind_mm_index

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_buffer_non_adaptive_qm_kind_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: The qm kind

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_extended_delta_charge
metaInfos.description: Additional net charge in extended region relative to core (core charge is  specified in DFT section, as usual for a convetional QM/MM calculation)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_max_n_qm
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of QM atoms, for detection of runaway adaptive selection.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_momentum_conservation_region
metaInfos.description: Region to apply correction force to for momentum conservation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_momentum_conservation_type
metaInfos.description: How to apply force to get momentum conservation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_qm_extended_seed_is_only_core_list
metaInfos.description: Makes the extended QM zone be defined hysterestically  by distance from QM core list (i.e. atoms specified explicitly by  user) instead of from full QM core region (specified by user + hysteretic  selection + unbreakable bonds)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_qm_kind_element_mapping
metaInfos.description: Mapping from elements to QM_KINDs for adaptively included atoms.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_qm_non_adaptive_qm_kind_mm_index
metaInfos.description: The indexes of the mm atoms that have this kind. This keyword can be repeated several times (useful if you have to specify many indexes).

metaInfos.description: The qm kind

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_r_buf
metaInfos.description: Specify the inner and outer radii of buffer region.  All atoms within this distance (hysteretically) of any QM atoms  will be buffer atoms in the force-mixing calculation.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_r_core
metaInfos.description: Specify the inner and outer radii of core QM region.  All molecules with any atoms within this distance (hysteretically) of any atoms  specified as QM in enclosing QM/MM section  will be core QM atoms in the force-mixing calculation.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_r_qm
metaInfos.description: Specify the inner and outer radii of QM dynamics region.  All molecules with atoms within this distance (hysteretically) of any atoms in  core will follow QM dynamics in the force-mixing calculation.

metaInfos.description: Specifies how the coefficients are determined.

metaInfos.description: External potential applied to the metal electrode

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_image_charge_image_restart_file_name
metaInfos.description: File name where to read the image matrix used as preconditioner in the iterative scheme

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_image_charge_mm_atom_list
metaInfos.description: List of MM atoms carrying an induced Gaussian charge. If this keyword is not given, all MM atoms will carry an image charge.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_image_charge_restart_image_matrix
metaInfos.description: Restart the image matrix. Useful when calculating coefficients iteratively (the image matrix is used as preconditioner in that case)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_image_charge_width
metaInfos.description: Specifies the value of the width of the (induced) Gaussian charge distribution carried by each MM atom.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_initial_translation_vector
metaInfos.description: This keyword specify the initial translation vector to be applied to the system.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_interpolator_aint_precond
metaInfos.description: the approximate inverse to use to get the starting point for the linear solver of the spline3 methods

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_interpolator_conv_info_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_interpolator_conv_info_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_interpolator_conv_info_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_interpolator_conv_info_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_interpolator_conv_info_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_interpolator_eps_r
metaInfos.description: accuracy on the residual for spline3 the interpolators

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_interpolator_eps_x
metaInfos.description: accuracy on the solution for spline3 the interpolators

metaInfos.description: the interpolator to use

metaInfos.description: the maximum number of iterations

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_interpolator_precond
metaInfos.description: The preconditioner used for the linear solver of the spline3 methods

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_interpolator_safe_computation
metaInfos.description: if a non unrolled calculation is to be performed in parallel

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_add_mm_charge_alpha
metaInfos.description: Specifies the scaling factor that defines the movement along the defined direction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_add_mm_charge_atom_index_1
metaInfos.description: Specifies the index of the first atom defining the direction along which the atom will be added

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_add_mm_charge_atom_index_2
metaInfos.description: Specifies the index of the second atom defining the direction along which  the atom will be added

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_add_mm_charge_charge
metaInfos.description: Specifies the charge for the added source of QM/MM potential

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_add_mm_charge_corr_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the correction radius used for the QM/MM electrostatic coupling for the added source

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_add_mm_charge_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the radius used for the QM/MM electrostatic coupling for the added source

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_alpha_imomm
metaInfos.description: Specifies the scaling factor to be used for projecting the forces on the capping hydrogen in the IMOMM QM/MM link scheme to the MM atom of the link. A good guess can be derived from the bond distances of the forcefield: alpha = r_eq(QM-MM) / r_eq(QM-H).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_corr_radius
metaInfos.description: Overwrite the specification of the correction radius only for the MM atom involved in the link.Default is to use the same correction radius as for the specified type.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_fist_scale_factor
metaInfos.description: Specifies the scaling factor for the MM charge involved in the link QM/MM. This keyword modifies the MM charge in FIST. The modified charge will be used then also for the generation of the QM/MM potential. Default 1.0 i.e. no charge rescaling of the MM atom of the QM/MM link bond.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_link_type
metaInfos.description: Specifies the method to use to treat the defined QM/MM link

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_mm_index
metaInfos.description: Specifies the index of the MM atom involved in the QM/MM link, Default hydrogen.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_move_mm_charge_alpha
metaInfos.description: Specifies the scaling factor that defines the movement along the defined direction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_move_mm_charge_atom_index_1
metaInfos.description: Specifies the index of the MM atom involved in the QM/MM link to be moved

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_move_mm_charge_atom_index_2
metaInfos.description: Specifies the index of the second atom defining the direction along which  the atom will be moved

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_move_mm_charge_corr_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the correction radius used for the QM/MM electrostatic coupling after movement

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_move_mm_charge_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the radius used for the QM/MM electrostatic coupling after movement

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_qm_index
metaInfos.description: Specifies the index of the QM atom involved in the QM/MM link

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_qm_kind
metaInfos.description: Specifies the element of the QM capping atom involved in the QM/MM link

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_qmmm_scale_factor
metaInfos.description: Specifies the scaling factor for the MM charge involved in the link QM/MM. This keyword affects only the QM/MM potential, it doesn't affect the electrostatic in  the classical part of the code. Default 1.0 i.e. no charge rescaling of the MM atom of the QM/MM link bond.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_link_radius
metaInfos.description: Overwrite the specification of the radius only for the MM atom involved in the link.Default is to use the same radius as for the specified type.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_mm_kind_corr_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the correction radius of the atomic kinds The correction radius is connected to the use of the compatibility keyword.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_mm_kind_radius
metaInfos.description: Specifies the radius of the atomic kinds

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_mm_kind_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: The MM  kind

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_mm_potential_file_name
metaInfos.description: Name of the file containing the potential expansion in gaussians. See the USE_GEEP_LIB keyword.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_nocompatibility
metaInfos.description: This keyword disables the compatibility of QM/MM potential between CPMD and CP2K implementations. The compatibility is achieved using an MM potential of the form: Erf[x/rc]/x + (1/rc -2/(pi^1/2*rc))*Exp[-(x/rc)^2] .This keyword has effect only selecting GAUSS E_COUPLING type.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_parallel_scheme
metaInfos.description: Chooses the parallel_scheme for the long range Potential

A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_multipole_program_run_info_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_multipole_rcut
metaInfos.description: Real space cutoff for the Ewald sum.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_multipole_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Defines the usage of the multipole section

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_ngrids
metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of grid points used for the Interpolation of the G-space term

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_alpha
metaInfos.description: alpha parameter associated with Ewald (EWALD|PME|SPME). Recommended for small systems is is alpha = 3.5 / r_cut. Tuning alpha, r_cut and gmax is needed to obtain O(N**1.5) scaling for ewald.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_epsilon
metaInfos.description: tolerance of gaussians for fft interpolation (PME only)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_ewald_accuracy
metaInfos.description: Expected accuracy in the Ewald sum. This number affects only the calculation of the cutoff for the real-space term of the ewald summation (EWALD|PME|SPME) as well as the construction of the neighbor lists (if the cutoff for non-bonded terms is smaller than the value employed to compute the EWALD real-space term). This keyword has no effect on the reciprocal space term (which can be tuned independently).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_ewald_type
metaInfos.description: The type of ewald you want to perform.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_gmax
metaInfos.description: number of grid points (SPME and EWALD). If a single number is specified,the same number of points is used for all three directions on the grid.If three numbers are given, each direction can have a different number of points.The number of points needs to be FFTable (which depends on the library used) and odd for EWALD.The optimal number depends e.g. on alpha and the size of the cell. 1 point per Angstrom is common.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_multipoles_eps_pol
metaInfos.description: Specify the rmsd threshold for the derivatives of the energy towards the Cartesian dipoles components

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_multipoles_max_ipol_iter
metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum number of iterations for induced dipoles

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_multipoles_max_multipole_expansion
metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum level of multipoles expansion used  for the electrostatics.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_multipoles_pol_scf
metaInfos.description: Specify the method to obtain self consistent induced multipole moments.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_multipoles_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Controls the activation of the Multipoles

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_ns_max
metaInfos.description: number of grid points on small mesh (PME only), should be odd.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_o_spline
metaInfos.description: order of the beta-Euler spline (SPME only)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rcut
metaInfos.description: Explicitly provide the real-space cutoff of the ewald summation (EWALD|PME|SPME). If present, overwrites the estimate of EWALD_ACCURACY and may affect the construction of the neighbor lists for non-bonded terms (in FIST), if the value specified is larger than the cutoff for non-bonded interactions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_distribution_layout
metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of slices in the x, y and z directions.-1 specifies that any number of slices is OK.If a given distribution can not be satisfied, a replicated grid will result.Also see LOCK_DISTRIBUTION.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_distribution_type
metaInfos.description: Parallelization strategy.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_halo_reduction_factor
metaInfos.description: Can be used to reduce the halo of the distributed grid (experimental features).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_lock_distribution
metaInfos.description: Expert use only, only basic QS deals correctly with a non-default value.If the distribution is locked, a grid will have the same distribution asthe next finer multigrid (provided it is distributed).If unlocked, all grids can be distributed freely.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_max_distributed_level
metaInfos.description: If the multigrid-level of a grid is larger than the parameter, it will not be distributed in the automatic scheme.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_memory_factor
metaInfos.description: A grid will only be distributed if the memory usage for that grid (including halo) is smaller than a replicated grid by this parameter.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_mt_alpha
metaInfos.description: Convergence parameter ALPHA*RMIN. Default value 7.0

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_mt_rel_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Specify the multiplicative factor for the CUTOFF keyword in MULTI_GRID  section. The result gives the cutoff at which the 1/r non-periodic FFT3D is evaluated.Default is 2.0

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_multipole_analytical_gterm
metaInfos.description: Evaluates the Gterm in the Ewald Scheme analytically instead of using Splines.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_multipole_program_run_info_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_multipole_rcut
metaInfos.description: Real space cutoff for the Ewald sum.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_periodic
metaInfos.description: Specify the directions on wich apply PBC. Important notice,  this only applies to the electrostatics. See the CELL section to specify the periodicity used for e.g. the pair lists. Typically the settings should be the same.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_poisson_solver
metaInfos.description: Specify which kind of solver to use to solve the Poisson equation.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_wavelet_scf_type
metaInfos.description: Type of scaling function used in the wavelet approach, the total energy depends on this choice,and the convergence with respect to cutoff depends on the selected scaling functions.Possible values are 8,14,16,20,24,30,40,50,60,100

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_replica
metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of replica to take into consideration for the real part of the calculation. Default is letting the qmmm module decide how many replica you really need.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_qm_kind_mm_index
metaInfos.description: The indexes of the mm atoms that have this kind. This keyword can be repeated several times (useful if you have to specify many indexes).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_qm_kind_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: The qm kind

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_spherical_cutoff
metaInfos.description: Set the spherical cutoff for the QMMM electrostatic interaction. This acts like a charge multiplicative factor dependent on cutoff. For MM atoms farther than the SPHERICAL_CUTOFF(1) their charge is zero. The switch is performed with a smooth function: 0.5*(1-TANH((r-[SPH_CUT(1)-20*SPH_CUT(2)])/(SPH_CUT(2)))). Two values are required: the first one is the distance cutoff. The second one controls the stiffness of the smoothing.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_use_geep_lib
metaInfos.description: This keyword enables the use of the internal GEEP library to generate the gaussian expansion of the MM potential. Using this keyword there's no need to provide the MM_POTENTIAL_FILENAME. It expects a number from 2 to 15 (the number of gaussian funtions to be used in the expansion.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_walls_k
metaInfos.description: Specify the value of the the force constant for the quadratic wall

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_walls_type
metaInfos.description: Specifies the type of wall

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_walls_wall_skin
metaInfos.description: Specify the value of the skin of the Wall in each dimension. The wall's effect is felt when atoms fall within the skin of the Wall.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_rescale_forces_max_force
metaInfos.description: Specify the Maximum Values of the force. If the force of one atom exceed this value it's rescaled to the MAX_FORCE value.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_stress_tensor
metaInfos.description: Controls the calculation of the stress tensor. The combinations defined below are not implemented for all methods.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_a
metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector A. This defines the first column of the h matrix.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_abc
metaInfos.description: Specify the lengths of the cell vectors A, B, and C, which defines the diagonal elements of h matrix for an orthorhombic cell. For non-orthorhombic cells it is possible either to specify the angles ALPHA, BETA, GAMMA via ALPHA_BETA_GAMMA keyword or alternatively use the keywords A, B, and C. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_alpha_beta_gamma
metaInfos.description: Specify the angles between the vectors A, B and C when using the ABC keyword. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane. ALPHA is the angle between B and C, BETA is the angle between A and C and GAMMA the angle between A and B.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_b
metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector B. This defines the second column of the h matrix.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_c
metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector C. This defines the third column of the h matrix.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_file_format
metaInfos.description: Specify the format of the cell file (if used)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_file_name
metaInfos.description: Possibility to read the cell from an external file

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_a
metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector A. This defines the first column of the h matrix.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_abc
metaInfos.description: Specify the lengths of the cell vectors A, B, and C, which defines the diagonal elements of h matrix for an orthorhombic cell. For non-orthorhombic cells it is possible either to specify the angles ALPHA, BETA, GAMMA via ALPHA_BETA_GAMMA keyword or alternatively use the keywords A, B, and C. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_alpha_beta_gamma
metaInfos.description: Specify the angles between the vectors A, B and C when using the ABC keyword. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane. ALPHA is the angle between B and C, BETA is the angle between A and C and GAMMA the angle between A and B.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_b
metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector B. This defines the second column of the h matrix.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_c
metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector C. This defines the third column of the h matrix.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_cell_file_format
metaInfos.description: Specify the format of the cell file (if used)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_cell_file_name

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_multiple_unit_cell
metaInfos.description: Specifies the numbers of repetition in space (X, Y, Z) of the defined cell, assuming it as a unit cell. This keyword affects only the CELL specification. The same keyword in SUBSYS%TOPOLOGY%MULTIPLE_UNIT_CELL should be modified in order to affect the coordinates specification.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_periodic
metaInfos.description: Specify the directions for which periodic boundary conditions (PBC) will be applied. Important notice: This applies to the generation of the pair lists as well as to the application of the PBCs to positions. See the POISSON section to specify the periodicity used for the electrostatics. Typically the settings should be the same.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_symmetry
metaInfos.description: Imposes an initial cell symmetry.

metaInfos.description: Name of the xyz file with coordinates (alternative to &COORD section)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_distance_from_path_function
metaInfos.description: Specifies the ith element of the vector valued function that defines the reaction path. This keyword needs to repeat exactly Q times, and the order must match the order of the colvars. The VARIABLE (e.g. T) which parametrises the curve can be used as the target of a constraint.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_distance_from_path_lambda
metaInfos.description: Specifies the exponent of the Gaussian used in the integral representation of the colvar.The shape of the space orthogonal to the reaction path is defined by this choice. In the limit of large values, it is given by the plane orthogonal to the path.In practice, modest values are required for stable numerical integration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_distance_from_path_map_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_distance_from_path_map_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_distance_from_path_map_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_distance_from_path_map_grid_spacing

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_reaction_path_function
metaInfos.description: Specifies the ith element of the vector valued function that defines the reaction path. This keyword needs to repeat exactly Q times, and the order must match the order of the colvars. The VARIABLE (e.g. T) which parametrises the curve can be used as the target of a constraint.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_reaction_path_lambda
metaInfos.description: Specifies the exponent of the Gaussian used in the integral representation of the colvar.The shape of the space orthogonal to the reaction path is defined by this choice. In the limit of large values, it is given by the plane orthogonal to the path.In practice, modest values are required for stable numerical integration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_reaction_path_map_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_reaction_path_map_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_reaction_path_map_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_basis_default_keyword
metaInfos.description:
CP2K Basis Set Standard Format 
Element symbol  Name of the basis set  Alias names
nset (repeat the following block of lines nset times)
n lmin lmax nexp nshell(lmin) nshell(lmin+1) ... nshell(lmax-1) nshell(lmax)
a(1)      c(1,l,1)      c(1,l,2) ...      c(1,l,nshell(l)-1)      c(1,l,nshell(l)), l=lmin,lmax
a(2)      c(2,l,1)      c(2,l,2) ...      c(2,l,nshell(l)-1)      c(2,l,nshell(l)), l=lmin,lmax
 .         .             .                 .                       .
 .         .             .                 .                       .
 .         .             .                 .                       .
a(nexp-1) c(nexp-1,l,1) c(nexp-1,l,2) ... c(nexp-1,l,nshell(l)-1) c(nexp-1,l,nshell(l)), l=lmin,lmax
a(nexp)   c(nexp,l,1)   c(nexp,l,2)   ... c(nexp,l,nshell(l)-1)   c(nexp,l,nshell(l)), l=lmin,lmax


nset     : Number of exponent sets
n        : Principle quantum number (only for orbital label printing)
lmax     : Maximum angular momentum quantum number l
lmin     : Minimum angular momentum quantum number l
nshell(l): Number of shells for angular momentum quantum number l
a        : Exponent
c        : Contraction coefficient
Source: ftp://ftp.aip.org/epaps/journ_chem_phys/E-JCPSA6-127-308733/BASIS_MOLOPT_JCP.txt

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_mm_radius
metaInfos.description: Defines the radius of the electrostatic multipole of the atom in Fist. This radius applies to the charge, the dipole and the quadrupole. When zero, the atom is treated as a point multipole, otherwise it is treated as a Gaussian charge distribution with the given radius: p(x,y,z)*N*exp(-(x**2+y**2+z**2)/(2*MM_RADIUS**2)), where N is a normalization constant. In the core-shell model, only the shell is treated as a Gaussian and the core is always a point charge.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_no_optimize
metaInfos.description: Skip optimization of this type (used in specific basis set or potential optimization schemes

metaInfos.description: CP2K Pseudo Potential Standard Format (GTH, ALL)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_radial_grid
metaInfos.description: The number of points for the radial part of the local grid (GAPW)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_rho0_exp_radius
metaInfos.description: the radius which defines the atomic region where the hard compensation density is confined.should be less than HARD_EXP_RADIUS (GAPW)(Bohr, default equals HARD_EXP_RADIUS)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_ri_aux_basis_set
metaInfos.description: The RI auxliliary basis set used in WF_CORRELATION (GTO type)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_se_p_orbitals_on_h
metaInfos.description: Forces the usage of p-orbitals on H for SEMI-EMPIRICAL calculations.  This keyword applies only when the KIND is specifying an Hydrogen element. In all  other cases is simply ignored.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: The name of the kind described in this section.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_multipoles_dipoles_default_keyword
metaInfos.description:
The dipole components for each atom in the format:

Dx Dy Dz

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_multipoles_quadrupoles_default_keyword
metaInfos.description:
The quadrupole components for each atom in the format:

Qxx Qxy Qxz Qyy Qyz Qzz

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_rng_init_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: Specify an initial RNG stream record

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_shell_coord_default_keyword
metaInfos.description:
The shell particle coordinates in the format:

ATOMIC_KIND X Y Z ATOMIC_INDEX

The ATOMIC_INDEX refers to the atom the shell particle belongs to.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_shell_coord_scaled
metaInfos.description: Specify if the coordinateds in input are scaled.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_shell_coord_unit
metaInfos.description: Specify the unit of measurement for the coordinates in inputAll available CP2K units can be used.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_shell_velocity_default_keyword
metaInfos.description:
The shell particle velocities in the format:

vx vy vz

The same order as for the shell particle coordinates is assumed.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_autogen_exclude_lists
metaInfos.description: When True, the exclude lists are solely based on the bond data in the topology. The (minimal) number of bonds between two atoms is used to determine if the atom pair is added to an exclusion list. When False, 1-2 exclusion is based on bonds in the topology, 1-3 exclusion is based on bonds and bends in the topology, 1-4 exclusion is based on bonds, bends and dihedrals in the topology. This implies that a missing dihedral in the topology will cause the corresponding 1-4 pair not to be in the exclusion list, in case 1-4 exclusion is requested for VDW or EI interactions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_center_coordinates_center_point
metaInfos.description: Specify the point used for centering the coordinates. Default is to center the system in cell/2.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_center_coordinates_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Controls the activation of the centering method

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_charge_beta
metaInfos.description: Read MM charges from the BETA field of PDB file.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_charge_extended
metaInfos.description: Read MM charges from the very last field of PDB file (starting from column 81). No limitations of number of digits.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_charge_occup
metaInfos.description: Read MM charges from the OCCUP field of PDB file.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_conn_file_format
metaInfos.description: Ways to determine and generate a molecules. Default is to use GENERATE

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_conn_file_name
metaInfos.description: Specifies the filename that contains the molecular connectivity.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_coord_file_format
metaInfos.description: Set up the way in which coordinates will be read.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_coord_file_name
metaInfos.description: Specifies the filename that contains coordinates.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_disable_exclusion_lists
metaInfos.description: Do not build any exclusion lists.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_pdb_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_pdb_charge_beta
metaInfos.description: Write the MM charges to the BETA field of the PDB file

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_pdb_charge_extended
metaInfos.description: Write the MM charges to the very last field of the PDB file (starting from column 81)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_pdb_charge_occup
metaInfos.description: Write the MM charges to the OCCUP field of the PDB file

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_pdb_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_pdb_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_pdb_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_pdb_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_psf_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_psf_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_psf_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_psf_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_psf_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_exclude_ei_list_bond
metaInfos.description: Specify the atom kinds involved in the bond for which 1-2 exclusion holds.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_exclude_vdw

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_exclude_vdw_list_bond
metaInfos.description: Specify the atom kinds involved in the bond for which 1-2 exclusion holds.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_angle_atoms
metaInfos.description: Specifies two atomic index united by a covalent bond

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_angle_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the bond

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_bond_atoms
metaInfos.description: Specifies two atomic index united by a covalent bond

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_bond_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the bond

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_bondlength_max
metaInfos.description: Maximum distance to generate neighbor lists to build connectivity

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_bondlength_min
metaInfos.description: Minimum distance to generate neighbor lists to build connectivity

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_bondparm
metaInfos.description: Used in conjunction with BONDPARM_FACTOR to help determine wheather there is bonding between two atoms based on a distance criteria. Can use covalent radii information or VDW radii information

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_bondparm_factor
metaInfos.description: Used in conjunction with BONDPARM to help determine wheather there is bonding between two atoms based on a distance criteria.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_create_molecules
metaInfos.description: Create molecules names and definition. Can be used to override the  molecules specifications of a possible input connectivity or to create molecules specifications for file types as XYZ, missing of molecules definitions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_improper_atoms
metaInfos.description: Specifies two atomic index united by a covalent bond

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_improper_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the bond

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_isolated_atoms_list
metaInfos.description: Specifies a list of atomic indexes of the isolated ion

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_neighbor_lists_geo_check
metaInfos.description: This keyword enables the check that two atoms are never below the minimum value used to construct the splines during the construction of the neighbouring list. Disabling this keyword avoids CP2K to abort in case two atoms are below the minimum  value of the radius used to generate the splines.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_neighbor_lists_neighbor_lists_from_scratch
metaInfos.description: This keyword enables the building of the neighbouring list from scratch.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_neighbor_lists_verlet_skin
metaInfos.description: Defines the Verlet Skin for the generation of the neighbor lists

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_reorder
metaInfos.description: Reorder a list of atomic coordinates into order so it can be packed correctly.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_torsion_atoms
metaInfos.description: Specifies two atomic index united by a covalent bond

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_torsion_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the bond

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_memory_progression_factor
metaInfos.description: This keyword is quite technical and should normally not be changed by the user. It affects the memory allocation during the construction of the topology. It does NOT affect the memory used once the topology is built.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_check
metaInfos.description: Check molecules have the same number of atom and names.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_merge_molecules_angles_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: Three integer indexes per line defining the new angle Indexes must be relative to the full system and not to the single molecules

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_merge_molecules_bonds_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: Two integer indexes per line defining the new bond. Indexes must be relative to the full system and not to the single molecules

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_merge_molecules_impropers_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: Four integer indexes per line defining the new improper Indexes must be relative to the full system and not to the single molecules

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_merge_molecules_torsions_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: Four integer indexes per line defining the new torsion Indexes must be relative to the full system and not to the single molecules

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_molecule_conn_file_format
metaInfos.description: Ways to determine and generate a molecules. Default is to use GENERATE

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_molecule_conn_file_name
metaInfos.description: Specifies the filename that contains the molecular connectivity.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_molecule_nmol
metaInfos.description: number of molecules

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_multiple_unit_cell
metaInfos.description: Specifies the numbers of repetition in space (X, Y, Z) of the defined cell, assuming it as a unit cell. This keyword affects only the coordinates specification. The same keyword in SUBSYS%CELL%MULTIPLE_UNIT_CELL should be modified in order to affect the cell specification.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_number_of_atoms
metaInfos.description: Optionally define the number of atoms read from an external file (see COORD_FILE_NAME) if the COORD_FILE_FORMAT CP2K is used

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_para_res
metaInfos.description: For a protein, each residue is now considered a molecule

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_use_g96_velocity
metaInfos.description: Use the velocities in the G96 coordinate files as the starting velocity

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_velocity_default_keyword
metaInfos.description:
The atomic velocities in the format:

vx vy vz

The same order as for the atomic coordinates is assumed.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_velocity_pint_unit
metaInfos.description: Specify the units of measurement for the velocities (currently works only for the path integral code). All available CP2K units can be used.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_alltoall_sgl
metaInfos.description: All-to-all communication (FFT) should use single precision

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_blacs_grid
metaInfos.description: how to distribute the processors on the 2d grid needed by BLACS (and thus SCALAPACK)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_blacs_repeatable
metaInfos.description: Use a topology for BLACS collectives that is guaranteed to be repeatable on homegeneous architectures

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_callgraph
metaInfos.description: At the end of the run write a callgraph to file, which contains detailed timing informations. This callgraph can be viewed e.g. with the open-source program kcachegrind.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_callgraph_file_name
metaInfos.description: Name of the callgraph file, which is writte a the end of the run. If not specified the project name will be used as filename.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_acc_avoid_after_busy
metaInfos.description: If enabled, stacks are not processed by the acc-driver after it has signaled congestion during a round of flushing. For the next round of flusing the driver is used again.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_acc_binning_binsize
metaInfos.description: Size of bins used when ordering the stacks with the binning-scheme.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_acc_binning_nbins
metaInfos.description: Number of bins used when ordering the stacks with the binning-scheme.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_acc_min_flop_process
metaInfos.description: Only process stacks with more than the given number of floating-point operations per stack-entry (2*m*n*k).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_acc_min_flop_sort
metaInfos.description: Only sort stacks with more than the given number of floating-point operations per stack-entry (2*m*n*k). Alternatively, the stacks are roughly ordered through a binning-scheme by Peter Messmer.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_acc_posterior_buffers
metaInfos.description: Number of transfer-buffers associated with low priority streams.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_acc_posterior_streams
metaInfos.description: Number of acc streams created with low priority.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_acc_priority_buffers
metaInfos.description: Number of transfer-buffers associated with high priority streams.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_acc_priority_streams
metaInfos.description: Number of acc streams created with high priority.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_acc_process_inhomogenous
metaInfos.description: If enabled, inhomogenous stacks are also processed by the acc driver.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_combined_types
metaInfos.description: Combine matrix index and data into a single MPI derived data type for communication (avoid using).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_comm_thread_load
metaInfos.description: If a communications thread is used, specify how much multiplication workload (%) the thread should perform in addition to communication tasks. A negative value leaves the decision up to DBCSR.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_max_elements_per_block
metaInfos.description: Default block size for turning dense matrices in blocked ones

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_mm_driver
metaInfos.description: Select which routines to use for matrix block multiplications.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_mm_stack_size
metaInfos.description: Size of multiplication parameter stack. A negative value leaves the decision up to DBCSR.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_multrec_limit
metaInfos.description: Recursion limit of cache oblivious multrec algorithm.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_n_size_mnk_stacks
metaInfos.description: Number of stacks to use for distinct atomic sizes (e.g., 2 for a system of mostly waters). A negative value leaves the decision up to DBCSR.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_subcommunicators
metaInfos.description: Use MPI subcommunicators for transfers that are limited to process grid rows and columns.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_use_comm_thread
metaInfos.description: During multiplication, use a thread to periodically poll MPI to progress outstanding message completions.  This is beneficial on systems without a DMA-capable network adapter e.g. Cray XE6.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_use_mpi_allocation
metaInfos.description: Allow use of MPI-allocated memory for potentially faster network communication.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_echo_all_hosts
metaInfos.description: Echo a list of hostname and pid for all MPI processes.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_echo_input
metaInfos.description: If the input should be echoed to the output with all the defaults made explicit

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_enable_unsupported_features
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the usage of unsupported features in a release version. It affects ONLY release versions of CP2K (no effects on development versions).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_extended_fft_lengths
metaInfos.description: Use fft library specific values for the allows number of points in FFTs. The default is to use the internal FFT lengths. For external fft libraries this may create an error at the external library level, because the length provided by cp2k is not supported by the external library. In this case switch on this keyword to obtain, with certain fft libraries, lengths matching the external fft library lengths, or larger allowed grids, or grids that more precisely match a given cutoff. IMPORTANT NOTE: in this case, the actual grids used in CP2K depends on the FFT library. A change of FFT library must therefore be considered equivalent to a change of basis, which implies a change of total energy.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fft_pool_scratch_limit
metaInfos.description: Limits the memory usage of the FFT scratch pool, potentially reducing efficiency a bit

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fftw_plan_type
metaInfos.description: FFTW can have improved performance if it is allowed to plan with explicit measurements which strategy is best for a given FFT. While a plan based on measurements is generally faster, differences in machine load will lead to different plans for the same input file, and thus numerics for the FFTs will be slightly different from run to run.PATIENT planning is recommended for long ab initio MD runs.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fftw_wisdom_file_name
metaInfos.description: The name of the file that contains wisdom (pre-planned FFTs) for use with FFTW3. Using wisdom can significantly speed up the FFTs (see the FFTW homepage for details). Note that wisdom is not transferable between different computer (architectures). Wisdom can be generated using the fftw-wisdom tool that is part of the fftw installation. cp2k/tools/cp2k-wisdom is a script that contains some additional info, and can help to generate a useful default for /etc/fftw/wisdom or particular values for a given simulation.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_flush_should_flush
metaInfos.description: Flush output regularly, enabling this option might degrade performance significantly on certain machines.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fm_force_block_size
metaInfos.description: Ensure for small matrices that the layout is compatible with bigger ones, i.e. no subdivision is performed (can break LAPACK!!!).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fm_ncol_blocks
metaInfos.description: Defines the number of columns per scalapack block in the creation of vlock cyclic dense matrices

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fm_nrow_blocks
metaInfos.description: Defines the number of rows per scalapack block in the creation of block cyclic dense matrices

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fm_type_of_matrix_multiplication
metaInfos.description: Allows to switch between scalapack pdgemm and dbcsr_multiply. On normal systems pdgemm is recommended on system with GPU is optimized and can give better performance. NOTE: if DBCSR is employed FORCE_BLOCK_SIZE should be set. The perfomance on GPU's dependes crucially on the BLOCK_SIZES. Make sure optimized kernels are available.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_mem_pol
metaInfos.description: Enable memory binding on the compute node.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_memory
metaInfos.description: The memory banks ID for each MPI process. It will beuse to set memory bank of the MPI process

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_mpi_reordering
metaInfos.description: Apply a global MPI reordering for the run

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_print_branch
metaInfos.description: Print machine architecture component organization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_print_full
metaInfos.description: Print full machine architecture

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_print_proc
metaInfos.description: Print the process binding in the machine.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_print_resume
metaInfos.description: Print the compute node architecture number of components.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_print_thread
metaInfos.description: Print the threads binding in the machine.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_print_thread_cur
metaInfos.description: Print the current threads binding in the machine.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_process
metaInfos.description: Core ID for each MPI process of a compute node. It will be used to place the MPI process.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_sched_mpi
metaInfos.description: Enable process scheduling on the compute node.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_sched_thread
metaInfos.description: Enable thread scheduling on the compute node.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_machine_arch_thread
metaInfos.description: Core ID for each thread of a compute node. It will be used to place the thread.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_output_file_name
metaInfos.description: Name of the output file. Relevant only if automatically started (through farming for example). If empty uses the project name as basis for it.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_preferred_diag_library
metaInfos.description: Specifies the DIAGONALIZATION library. If not availabe ....

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_preferred_fft_library
metaInfos.description: Specifies the FFT library which should be preferred. If it is not available, use FFTW3 if this is linked in, if FFTW3 is not available use FFTSG. Improved performance with FFTW3 can be obtained specifying a proper value for FFTW_PLAN_TYPE. Contrary to earlier CP2K versions, all libraries will result in the same grids, i.e. the subset of grids which all FFT libraries can transform. See EXTENDED_FFT_LENGTHS if larger FFTs or grids that more precisely match a given cutoff are needed, or older results need to be reproduced. FFTW3 is often (close to) optimal, and well tested with CP2K.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_print_level
metaInfos.description: How much output is written out.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_program_name
metaInfos.description: Which program should be run

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_program_run_info_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_program_run_info_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_program_run_info_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_program_run_info_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_diis_check_diis
metaInfos.description: Performes a series of checks on the DIIS solution in order to accept the DIIS step. If set to .FALSE. the only check performed is that the angle between the DIIS solution and the reference vector is less than Pi/2. Can be useful if many DIIS steps are rejected.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_diis_max_sd_steps
metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum number of SD steps to perform before switching on DIIS (the minimum number will always be equal to N_DIIS).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_diis_max_steps
metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum number of optimization steps

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_diis_max_stepsize
metaInfos.description: Maximum stepsize used for the line search, sometimes this parametercan be reduced to stablize the LS for particularly difficult initial geometries

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_diis_n_diis
metaInfos.description: Number of history vectors to be used with DIIS

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_diis_no_ls
metaInfos.description: Does not perform LS during SD. Useful in combination with a proper STEPSIZE for particularly out of equilibrium starting geometries.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_diis_np_ls
metaInfos.description: Number of points used in the line search SD.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_diis_stepsize
metaInfos.description: Initial stepsize used for the line search, sometimes this parametercan be reduced to stablize DIIS

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_max_steps
metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum number of MD steps

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_temp_control_temp_tol
metaInfos.description: Specify the tolerance on the temperature for rescaling

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_temp_control_temp_tol_steps
metaInfos.description: Specify the number of steps to apply a temperature control

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_temp_control_temperature
metaInfos.description: Specify the target temperature

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_temperature
metaInfos.description: Specify the initial temperature

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_timestep
metaInfos.description: The length of an integration step

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_vel_control_annealing
metaInfos.description: Specify the annealing coefficient

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_vel_control_proj_velocity_verlet
metaInfos.description: Uses a Projected Velocity Verlet instead of a normal Velocity Verlet. Every time the cosine between velocities and forces is < 0 velocities are zeroed.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_vel_control_sd_like
metaInfos.description: Zeros velocity at each MD step emulating a steepest descent like(SD_LIKE) approach

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_opt_type
metaInfos.description: Specifies the type optimizer used for the band

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_optimize_band_optimize_end_points
metaInfos.description: Performs also an optimization of the end points of the band.

metaInfos.description: Specifies the type of potential used in the BAND calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_proc_dist_type
metaInfos.description: Specify the topology of the mapping of processors into replicas.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_replica_velocity_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: Specify velocities of the system

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_rotate_frames
metaInfos.description: Compute at each BAND step the RMSD and rotate the frames in order to minimize it.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_string_method_smoothing
metaInfos.description: Smoothing parameter for the reparametrization of the frames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_string_method_spline_order
metaInfos.description: Specify the oder of the spline used in the String Method.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_band_use_colvars
metaInfos.description: Uses a version of the band scheme projected in a subspace of colvars.

Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_restart_file_name
metaInfos.description: Specifies the name of the file used to read the initial Hessian.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_restart_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_restart_hessian
metaInfos.description: Controls the reading of the initial Hessian from file.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_restart_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_restart_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_trust_radius
metaInfos.description: Trust radius used in BFGS. Previously set to 0.1. Large values can lead to instabilities

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_use_model_hessian
metaInfos.description: Uses a model Hessian as initial guess instead of a unit matrix. Should lead in general to improved convergence might be switched off for exotic cases

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_use_rat_fun_opt
metaInfos.description: Includes a rational function optimization to determine the step. Previously default but did not improve convergence in many cases

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_fletcher_reeves
metaInfos.description: Uses FLETCHER-REEVES instead of POLAK-RIBIERE when using Conjugate Gradients

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_2pnt_linmin_grad_only
metaInfos.description: Use only the gradient, not the energy for line minimizations (e.g. in conjugate gradients).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_2pnt_max_allowed_step
metaInfos.description: Max allowed value for the line search step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brack_limit
metaInfos.description: Limit in 1D bracketing during line search in Conjugate Gradients Optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brent_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iterations in brent algorithm (used for the line search in Conjugated Gradients Optimization)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brent_tol
metaInfos.description: Tolerance requested during Brent line search in Conjugate Gradients Optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_initial_step
metaInfos.description: Initial step size used, e.g. for bracketing or minimizers. Might need to be reduced for systems with close contacts

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_type
metaInfos.description: 1D line search algorithm to be used with the CG optimizer, in increasing order of robustness and cost.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_max_steep_steps
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of steepest descent steps before starting the conjugate gradients optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_restart_limit
metaInfos.description: Cosine of the angle between two consecutive searching directions. If the angle during a CG optimization is less than the one corresponding to  to the RESTART_LIMIT the CG is reset and one step of steepest descent is  performed.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_external_pressure
metaInfos.description: Specifies the external pressure (1 value or the full 9 components of the pressure tensor) applied during the cell optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_keep_angles
metaInfos.description: Keep angles between the cell vectors constant, but allow the lenghts of the cell vectors to change independently. Albeit general, this is most useful for triclinic cells, to enforce higher symmetry, see KEEP_SYMMETRY.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_keep_symmetry
metaInfos.description: Keep the requested initial cell symmetry (e.g. during a cell optimisation). The initial symmetry must be specified in the &CELL section.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_lbfgs_max_f_per_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of force evaluations per iteration(used for the line search)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_lbfgs_max_h_rank
metaInfos.description: Maximum rank (and consequently size) of the approximate Hessian matrix used by the LBFGS optimizer. Larger values (e.g. 30) will accelerate the convergence behaviour at the cost of a larger memory consumption.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_lbfgs_wanted_proj_gradient
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium (overrides the general ones):Requested norm threshold of the gradient multiplied by the approximate Hessian.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_lbfgs_wanted_rel_f_error
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium (overrides the general ones):Requested relative error on the objective functionof the optimizer (the energy)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_max_dr
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium for the maximum geometry change between the current and the last optimizer iteration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_max_force
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium for the maximum force component of the current configuration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Specifies the maximum number of geometry optimization steps. One step might imply several force evaluations for the CG and LBFGS optimizers.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_optimizer

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_pressure_tolerance
metaInfos.description: Specifies the Pressure tolerance (compared to the external pressure) to achieve during the cell optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_rms_dr
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium for the root mean square (RMS) geometry change between the current and the last optimizer iteration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_rms_force
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium for the root mean square (RMS) force of the current configuration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_step_start_val
metaInfos.description: The starting step value for the CELL_OPT module.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_type
metaInfos.description: Specify which kind of method to use for the optimization of the simulation cell

metaInfos.description: Specifies the index of the molecule kind (in input file order)on which the constraint will be applied. MOLECULE and MOLNAME keyword exclude themself mutually.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_constraint_collective_target_growth

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_constraint_collective_target_limit

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_constraint_colvar_restart_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: The restarting values for COLVAR restraints. The order is an internal order. So if you decide to modify these values by hand first think what you're doing!

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_constraint_constraint_info_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.
