metaInfos.description: Specified the theta

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_ext_lagrange_ss0_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: Specified the positions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_ext_lagrange_ss_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: Specified the theta

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_ext_lagrange_vvp_default_keyword
metaInfos.description: Specified the velocities

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_hill_tail_cutoff
metaInfos.description: By setting this variable larger than 0 the tail of the Gaussian hill  is damped to zero faster. The Gaussian function is multiplied by a cutoff function that becomes active at |x-X0|>HILL_TAIL_CUTOFF*SCALE, where X0 is the location of the Gaussian and SCALE is the width of the Gaussian. For more than one METAVAR X0 and SCALE are METAVAR-dependent.  (1-(|x-X0|/HILL_TAIL_CUTOFF*SCALE)^P_EXP)/(1-(|x-X0|/HILL_TAIL_CUTOFF*SCALE)^Q_EXP)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_lagrange
metaInfos.description: Specifies whether an extended-lagrangian should be used. Default .FALSE.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_langevin
metaInfos.description: If a Lagrangian scheme is used the eq. motion of the COLVARS are integrated with a LANGEVIN scheme.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_colvar
metaInfos.description: Specifies the colvar on which to apply metadynamics.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_gamma
metaInfos.description: Specifies the friction term in Langevin integration of the collective variable in the extended lagrangian scheme.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_lambda
metaInfos.description: Specifies the lambda parameter of the collective variable in the extended lagrangian scheme.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_mass
metaInfos.description: Specifies the mass parameter of the collective variable in the extended lagrangian scheme.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_scale
metaInfos.description: Specifies the scale factor for the following collective variable. The history dependent term has the expression: WW * Sum_{j=1}^{nhills} Prod_{k=1}^{ncolvar} [EXP[-0.5*((ss-ss0(k,j))/SCALE(k))^2]], where ncolvar is the number of defined METAVAR and nhills is the number of spawned hills.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_gaussian_sigma
metaInfos.description: Specify the width of the gaussian: WW*e^(-((CV-POS)/sigma)^2)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_gaussian_ww
metaInfos.description: Specify the height of the gaussian: WW*e^(-((CV-POS)/sigma)^2)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_position
metaInfos.description: Specify the value of the colvar for the wall position

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_quadratic_direction
metaInfos.description: Specify the direction of the wall.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_quadratic_k
metaInfos.description: Specify the value of the quadratic potential constant: K*(CV-POS)^2

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_quartic_direction
metaInfos.description: Specify the direction of the wall.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_quartic_k
metaInfos.description: Specify the value of the quartic potential constant: K*(CV-(POS+/-(1/K^(1/4))))^4

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_reflective_direction
metaInfos.description: Specify the direction of the wall.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_type
metaInfos.description: Specify the type of wall

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_min_disp
metaInfos.description: Minimum displacement between hills before placing a new hill.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_min_nt_hills
metaInfos.description: Specify the minimum MD step interval between spawning two hills. If specified, it must be >= than NT_HILLS. In case MIN_DISP is used, if MIN_DISP is satisfied before MIN_NT_HILLS MD steps have been performed, the MD will continue without any spawning until MIN_NT_HILLS is reached. The default value has the net effect of skipping this check.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_geo_opt_bfgs_restart_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_geo_opt_bfgs_restart_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_geo_opt_bfgs_restart_file_name
metaInfos.description: Specifies the name of the file used to read the initial Hessian.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_geo_opt_bfgs_restart_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_geo_opt_bfgs_restart_hessian

metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_angvel_tol
metaInfos.description: The maximum accepted angular velocity. This option is ignored when the system is periodic. Removes the components of the velocities thatproject on the external rotational degrees of freedom.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_angvel_zero
metaInfos.description: Set the initial angular velocity to zero. This option is ignored when the system is periodic or when initial velocities are defined. Technically, the part of the random initial velocities that projects on the external rotational degrees of freedom is subtracted.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_annealing
metaInfos.description: Specifies the rescaling factor for annealing velocities. Automatically enables the annealing procedure. This scheme works only for ensembles that do not have thermostats on particles.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_annealing_cell
metaInfos.description: Specifies the rescaling factor for annealing velocities of the CELL Automatically enables the annealing procedure for the CELL. This scheme works only for ensambles that do not have thermostat on CELLS velocities.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_averages_acquisition_start_time
metaInfos.description: Setup up the simulation time when the acquisition process to compute  averages is started.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_averages_average_colvar
metaInfos.description: Switch for computing the averages of COLVARs.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_averages_print_averages_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_averages_print_averages_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_averages_print_averages_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_averages_print_averages_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

Defines the list of atoms for which the velocities are modified. Each record consists of the atomic index, the velocity vector, and a weight to define which fraction of the total energy is assigned to the current atom:

Atomic_index vx vy vx Weight

metaInfos.description: controls the activation of core-level spectroscopy simulations

metaInfos.description: Stride in number of snapshot for the  reftraj analysis

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_reftraj_traj_file_name
metaInfos.description: Specify the filename where the trajectory is stored.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_reftraj_variable_volume
metaInfos.description: Enables the possibility to read a CELL file with information on the CELL size during the MD.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_respa_frequency
metaInfos.description: The number of reference MD steps between two RESPA corrections.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_scale_temp_kind
metaInfos.description: When necessary rescale the temperature per each kind separately

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_shell_displacement_shell_tol
metaInfos.description: This keyword sets a maximum variation of the shell core distance in each Cartesian direction.The maximum internal core-shell velocity is evaluated and if it is too large to remainwithin the assigned limit, the time step is rescaled accordingly,and the first half step of the velocity verlet is repeated.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_shell_nose_particle
metaInfos.description: If nvt or npt, the core and shell velocities are controlled by the same thermostat used for the particle. This might favour heat exchange and additional rescaling of the internal core-shell velocity is needed (TEMP_TOL)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_shell_temp_tol
metaInfos.description: Maximum accepted temperature deviation from the expected value, for the internal core-shell motion.If 0, no rescaling is performed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_shell_temperature
metaInfos.description: Temperature in K used to control the internal velocities of the core-shell motion

metaInfos.description: Specify an initial thermostat DOF CHI for Ad-Langevin thermostat.

metaInfos.description: Specify an initial thermostat DOF MASS for Ad-Langevin thermostat.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_shell_thermostat_ad_langevin_timecon_langevin
metaInfos.description: Time constant of the Langevin part of the AD_LANGEVIN thermostat. A small time constant will result in strong thermostatting (useful for initial equilibrations) and a large time constant would be adequate to get weak thermostatting in production runs.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_shell_thermostat_ad_langevin_timecon_nh
metaInfos.description: Time constant of the Nose-Hoover part of the AD_LANGEVIN thermostat. A small time constant will result in strong thermostatting (useful for initial equilibrations) and a large time constant would be adequate to get weak thermostatting in production runs.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_md_temp_tol
metaInfos.description: The maximum accepted deviation of the (global) temperaturefrom the desired target temperature before a rescaling of the velocites is performed. If it is 0 no rescaling is performed. NOTE: This keyword is obsolescent; Using a CSVR thermostat with a short timeconstant is recommended as a better alternative.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_pint_init_centroid_speed
metaInfos.description: adds random velocity component to the centroid modes (useful to correct for the averaging out of the speed of various beads)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_pint_init_levy_seed
metaInfos.description: Initial seed for the (pseudo)random number generator that controls Levy walk for bead positions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_pint_init_levy_temp_factor
metaInfos.description: Multiplicative correction factor for the temperature at which the Levy walk is performed (correction is due to the interactions that modify the spread of a free particle)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_pint_init_randomize_pos

Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_print_cell_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.description: Specifies the name of the file used to read the initial Hessian.

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_bfgs_restart_hessian
metaInfos.description: Controls the reading of the initial Hessian from file.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_bfgs_restart_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_bfgs_restart_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_bfgs_trust_radius
metaInfos.description: Trust radius used in BFGS. Previously set to 0.1. Large values can lead to instabilities

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_bfgs_use_model_hessian
metaInfos.description: Uses a model Hessian as initial guess instead of a unit matrix. Should lead in general to improved convergence might be switched off for exotic cases

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_bfgs_use_rat_fun_opt
metaInfos.description: Includes a rational function optimization to determine the step. Previously default but did not improve convergence in many cases

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_fletcher_reeves
metaInfos.description: Uses FLETCHER-REEVES instead of POLAK-RIBIERE when using Conjugate Gradients

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_2pnt_linmin_grad_only
metaInfos.description: Use only the gradient, not the energy for line minimizations (e.g. in conjugate gradients).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_2pnt_max_allowed_step
metaInfos.description: Max allowed value for the line search step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brack_limit
metaInfos.description: Limit in 1D bracketing during line search in Conjugate Gradients Optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brent_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iterations in brent algorithm (used for the line search in Conjugated Gradients Optimization)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brent_tol
metaInfos.description: Tolerance requested during Brent line search in Conjugate Gradients Optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_initial_step
metaInfos.description: Initial step size used, e.g. for bracketing or minimizers. Might need to be reduced for systems with close contacts

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_type
metaInfos.description: 1D line search algorithm to be used with the CG optimizer, in increasing order of robustness and cost.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_max_steep_steps
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of steepest descent steps before starting the conjugate gradients optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_restart_limit
metaInfos.description: Cosine of the angle between two consecutive searching directions. If the angle during a CG optimization is less than the one corresponding to  to the RESTART_LIMIT the CG is reset and one step of steepest descent is  performed.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_lbfgs_max_f_per_iter
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of force evaluations per iteration(used for the line search)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_lbfgs_max_h_rank
metaInfos.description: Maximum rank (and consequently size) of the approximate Hessian matrix used by the LBFGS optimizer. Larger values (e.g. 30) will accelerate the convergence behaviour at the cost of a larger memory consumption.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_lbfgs_wanted_proj_gradient
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium (overrides the general ones):Requested norm threshold of the gradient multiplied by the approximate Hessian.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_lbfgs_wanted_rel_f_error
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium (overrides the general ones):Requested relative error on the objective functionof the optimizer (the energy)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_max_dr
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium for the maximum geometry change between the current and the last optimizer iteration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_max_force
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium for the maximum force component of the current configuration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_max_iter
metaInfos.description: Specifies the maximum number of geometry optimization steps. One step might imply several force evaluations for the CG and LBFGS optimizers.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_optimizer
metaInfos.description: Specify which method to use to perform a geometry optimization.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_rms_dr
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium for the root mean square (RMS) geometry change between the current and the last optimizer iteration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_rms_force
metaInfos.description: Convergence criterium for the root mean square (RMS) force of the current configuration.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_step_start_val
metaInfos.description: The starting step value for the SHELL_OPT module.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_all_conf_file_name
metaInfos.description: file name for printing every single calculated configuration (e.g. for fitting).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_dot_tree
metaInfos.description: file name for GrapgViz dot file

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_energy_file_name
metaInfos.description: input file name for the exact potential energy calculation.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_esimate_acc_prob
metaInfos.description: set the estimation of the acceptance probability using run time information of the energy

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_group_anlysis_nr
metaInfos.description: amount of groups (cores) for analysing the configurations

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_group_cc_size
metaInfos.description: amount of of CPUs per group for configurational change

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_group_energy_nr
metaInfos.description: amount of groups for exact energy calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_group_energy_size
metaInfos.description: amount of CPUs per group for energy calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_info_out_step_size
metaInfos.description: the number the amount of calculated configurations between to output printings.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_move_center_of_mass
metaInfos.description: Moves the center of mass of defined molecules (in volume moves)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_move_type_atoms
metaInfos.description: Defines the atomic kinds involved in the move. Up to now only used for the atom swap.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_move_type_init_acc_prob
metaInfos.description: Defines the initial probability of accepting the move.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_move_type_prob

metaInfos.description: Defines the initial probability of accepting the move.

metaInfos.description: Defines the probability of the move (considering the ration between the selected moves)

metaInfos.description: The name of the move type described in this section.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_nmc_moves_move_type_size
metaInfos.description: Defines the size of the move:ATOM_TRANS [A], MOL_TRANS [A], MOL_ROT [degree], PROT_REORDER [], VOL_MOVE [A], ATOM_SWAP

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_nmc_moves_nmc_file_name

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_nmc_moves_nr_nmc_steps
metaInfos.description: the number of Nested Mont Carlo moves with in one MC move should be huge enough to reach euilibrium state

metaInfos.description: the number of different temperature for parallel tempering

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_num_mv_elem_in_cell
metaInfos.description: the number of elements (atoms or molecules) moves in cell or sub box.if 0 all elements are moved once in a MC move

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_pressure
metaInfos.description: enables NPT calculation with specified constant pressure [bar]

metaInfos.description: enables the calculation and printing the exact cell dipoles (only for QS methods)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_print_energies
metaInfos.description: printing the different calculated energies (approximated, scf and exact)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_print_forces
metaInfos.description: printing forces of the Markov Chain elements

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_print_only_acc
metaInfos.description: printing only accepted elements of the Markov Chain.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_print_test_output
metaInfos.description: printing different values for regtest comparison

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_restart_in
metaInfos.description: if existing use the last restart file

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_restart_out
metaInfos.description: Defines the frequency to write restart files. If no frequency is specified (lone keyword) the restart file is written at the end (only). If the value is 0, no restart file is written at all. The frequency specifies is related to the calculated Markov chain elements

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_result_list_in_memory
metaInfos.description: enables the storing of the whole Markov Chain

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_rnd_deterministic

metaInfos.description: enables or disables the speculative canceling. If we have further knowledge of acceptance probabilities using parent acceptance or the estimated energy.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_sub_box
metaInfos.description: specifies the size ot the sub box. Standard moves only within subbox of random position, to compensate the potential difference of the approximate potential.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_task_type
metaInfos.description: Select specialized types. Selectable:IDEAL_GAS (constant configuration energy E=0.0),

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_temperature
metaInfos.description: one temperatue OR for parallel tempering: Tmin Tmax or each temperature T1 T2 T3 ... If every single temperature is specified, do NOT use keyword NR_TEMPERATURE

metaInfos.description: one temperatue OR for parallel tempering: Tmin Tmax or each temperature T1 T2 T3 ... If every single temperature is specified, do NOT use keyword NR_TEMPERATURE

metaInfos.description: Radial Distribution Function for each pair of atomsusing the amount of specified bins within MAX(cell_lenght)/2

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_use_scf_energy_info
metaInfos.description: enables or disables the usage of SCF energy information for  estimating the acceptance probability.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_tmc_volume_isotropic
metaInfos.description: volume move is equal in each direction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_multiple_force_evals_force_eval_order
metaInfos.description: Specify the orders of the different force_eval. When using a MIXED force_eval this does not need to be specified in this list, because it that takes into account only the real energy contributions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_multiple_force_evals_multiple_subsys
metaInfos.description: Specify if force_eval have different subsys. In case they share the same subsys, it needs to be specified only in the MIXED force_eval (if using MIXED) or in the force_eval corresponding to first force_eval of the previous order (when not using MIXED).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_basis_combinations
metaInfos.description: If multiple atomic kinds are fitted at the same time, this keyword allows to specify which basis sets should be used together in optimization (underived set ID=0). If skipped all combinations are used. The order is taken as the kinds and sets are specified in the input

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_basis_output_file
metaInfos.description: Name of the basis set file containing the optimized basis

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_basis_template_file
metaInfos.description: Name of the basis set file, containing the structure of the new basis set

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_basis_work_file
metaInfos.description: Name of the basis set file which is created to be read as initial guess

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_condition_weight
metaInfos.description: This keyword allows to give different weight factors to the condition number of different basis combinations (LOG(cond) is used). The first entry corresponds to the original basis sets. Every further value is assigned to the combinations in the order given for BASIS_COMBINATIONS.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_basis_set
metaInfos.description: The name of the basis set for the kind. Has to be specified in BASIS_TEMPLATE_FILE.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_constrain_exponents_boundaries
metaInfos.description: Defines the boundaries to which the optimization is restricted. First value is the lower bound, second value is the upper bound.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_constrain_exponents_max_var_fraction
metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum fractionr by which the exponent is allowed to vary. e.g. 0.5 allows the exp to vary by 0.5*exp in both directions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_constrain_exponents_use_exp
metaInfos.description: Defines the exponent to be constraint. The two integers indicate the set number and i'th exponent. The value -1 can be used to mark all sets/expoenents in a set.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_derived_basis_sets_reference_set
metaInfos.description: Specifies the reference basis ID which is used as template to create the new set. The original basis has ID 0. All follwing sets are counted in order as specified in the Input. The decriptors always assume the structure of the input basis set.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_derived_basis_sets_remove_contraction
metaInfos.description: Can be used to remove a contraction from the reference basis set. The contraction is speciefied by set number, angular momentum and number of contraction. The decriptors always assume the structure of the input basis set.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_derived_basis_sets_remove_set
metaInfos.description: Can be used to remove a set from the reference basis set.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_initial_degrees_of_freedom
metaInfos.description: Specifies the initial degrees of freedom in the basis optimization.This can be used to make further specifications easier

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: The name of the kind described in this section.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_switch_coeff_state
metaInfos.description: Allows to switch the state of a given coefficient from current state (varibale/fixed)) to the opposite state. The three integers indicate the set number, the angular momentum i'th contraction and i'th coefficient

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_switch_contraction_state
metaInfos.description: Allows to switch the state of a given contraction from current state (varibale/fixed)) to the opposite state. The three integers indicate the set number, the angular momentum and i'th contraction

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_switch_exp_state
metaInfos.description: Allows to switch the state of a given exponent from current state (varibale/fixed)) to the opposite state. The two integers indicate the set number and i'th exponent

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_switch_set_state
metaInfos.description: Allows to switch the states of in a set from current state (varibale/fixed)) to the opposite state. The two integers indicate the affected part (0=ALL,1=EXPS,2=COEFF) and i'th set

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_group_partition
metaInfos.description: Allows the specification of the group mpi group sizes in parallel runs. If less Groups than tasks are speciefied, consecutive calculations  Will be assigned to one group (derived basis sets and then training sets) If keyword is skipped, equal group sizes will be generated trying to fit all calculations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_optimization_accuracy
metaInfos.description: Final accuracy requested in optimization (RHOEND)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_optimization_max_fun
metaInfos.description: Maximum number of function evaluations

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_optimization_step_size
metaInfos.description: Initial step size for search algorithm (RHOBEG)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_residuum_weight
metaInfos.description: This keyword allows to give different weight factors to the residuum of the different basis combinations. The first entry corresponds to the original basis sets. Every further value is assigned to the combinations in the order given for BASIS_COMBINATIONS.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_training_files_directory
metaInfos.description: the directory in which the files are placed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_training_files_input_file_name
metaInfos.description: the filename of the input file used to run the original calcuation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_use_condition_number
metaInfos.description: Determines whether condition number should be part of optimization or not

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_write_frequency
metaInfos.description: Frequency at which the intermediate results should be written

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_input_accuracy
metaInfos.description: Final accuracy requested in optimization (RHOEND)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_input_force_matching_compare_energies_add_last
metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_input_force_matching_compare_energies_common_iteration_levels
metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_input_force_matching_compare_energies_filename
metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_input_force_matching_compare_energies_log_print_key
metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_input_force_matching_compare_energies_section_parameters
metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input

Only some of the sections that control printing (PRINT, EACH) are supported, because including all of them would double the size of this metadata without adding much useful information. The hidden input keywords starting with a double underscore are not included.

Describes a farming job, in which multiple inputs are executed.
The RUN_TYPE in the global section has to be set to NONE for FARMING.
The different groups are executed in parallel. The jobs inside the same groups in series.

metaInfos.description: Define type and parameters for mixingprocedures to be applied to the density matrix. Normally, only one type of mixing method should be accepted. The mixing procedures activated by this section are only active for diagonalization methods, i.e. not with minimization methods based on OT.

metaInfos.description: Sets the various options for the orbital transformation (OT) method. Default settings already provide an efficient, yet robust method. Most systems benefit from using the FULL_ALL preconditioner combined with a small value (0.001) of ENERGY_GAP.Well-behaved systems might benefit from using a DIIS minimizer.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_scf_mixing
metaInfos.description: Define type and parameters for mixingprocedures to be applied to the density matrix. Normally, only one type of mixing method should be accepted. The mixing procedures activated by this section are only active for diagonalization methods, i.e. not with minimization methods based on OT.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot
metaInfos.description: Sets the various options for the orbital transformation (OT) method. Default settings already provide an efficient, yet robust method. Most systems benefit from using the FULL_ALL preconditioner combined with a small value (0.001) of ENERGY_GAP.Well-behaved systems might benefit from using a DIIS minimizer.

The mixing procedures activated by this section are only active for diagonalization methods, i.e. not with minimization methods based on OT.

Most systems benefit from using the FULL_ALL preconditioner combined with a small value (0.001) of ENERGY_GAP.Well-behaved systems might benefit from using a DIIS minimizer.

metaInfos.description: Uses the PerdewWang correlation functional.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_functional_pz81
metaInfos.description: Uses the PZ functional.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_functional_tf
metaInfos.description: Uses the TF functional

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_functional_tfw
metaInfos.description: Uses the TFW functional

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_functional_tpss
metaInfos.description: Uses the TPSS functional

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_functional_vwn
metaInfos.description: Uses the VWN functional

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_functional_xalpha
metaInfos.description: Uses the XALPHA (SLATER) functional.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_functional_xgga
metaInfos.description: Uses one of the XGGA functionals (optimized versions of some of these functionals might be available outside this section).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_functional_xwpbe
metaInfos.description: Uses the short range PBE functional

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_grid
metaInfos.description: The xc parameters used when calculating the xc on the grid

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_potential
metaInfos.description: The xc potential to use (CAREFUL: xc potential here refers to potentials that are not derived from an xc functional, but rather are modelled directly. Therefore there is no consistent xc energy available. To still get an energy expression, see ENERGY below

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_dft_xc_xc_potential_saop
metaInfos.description: Uses the SAOP potential

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_eip
metaInfos.description: This section contains all information to run an Empirical Interatomic Potential (EIP) calculation.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_ep
metaInfos.description: parameter needed by an ep calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_external_potential
metaInfos.description: Section controlling the presence of an external potential dependent  on the atomic positions (X,Y,Z)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed
metaInfos.description: This section contains all information to run with a hamiltonian defined by a mixing of force_evals

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed_coupling
metaInfos.description: Coupling between two force_eval: E=(E1+E2 - sqrt((E1-E2)**2+4*H12**2))/2

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed_generic
metaInfos.description: User driven coupling between two or more force_eval.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed_linear
metaInfos.description: Linear combination between two force_eval:  F= lambda F1 + (1-lambda) F2

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed_mapping
metaInfos.description: Defines the mapping of atoms for the different force_eval with the mixed force_eval. The default is to have a mapping 1-1 between atom index (i.e. all force_eval share the same geometrical structure). The mapping is based on defining fragments and the mapping the  fragments between the several force_eval and the mixed force_eval

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed_mapping_force_eval
metaInfos.description: Defines the fragments and the mapping for each force_eval (an integer index (ID) needs to be provided as parameter)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed_mapping_force_eval_fragment
metaInfos.description: Fragment definition

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed_mapping_force_eval_mixed
metaInfos.description: Defines the fragments for the mixed force_eval (reference)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed_mapping_force_eval_mixed_fragment
metaInfos.description: Fragment definition

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed_restraint
metaInfos.description: Restraint between two force_eval: E = E1 + k*(E1-E2-t)**2

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm
metaInfos.description: This section contains all information to run a MM calculation.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield
metaInfos.description: Section specifying information regarding how to set up properly a force_field for the classical calculations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_bend
metaInfos.description: Specifies the bend potential of the MM system.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_bend_ub
metaInfos.description: Specifies the Urey-Bradley potential between the external atoms defining the angle

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_bond
metaInfos.description: Specifies the bond potential

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_charge
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the charge of the MM atoms

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_charges
metaInfos.description: Allow to specify an array of classical charges, thus avoiding the packing and permitting the usage of different charges for same atomic types.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_dipole
metaInfos.description: This section specifies that we will perform an SCF dipole calculation of the MM atoms. Needs KEYWORD POL_SCF in POISSON secton

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_dipole_damping
metaInfos.description: This section specifies optional electric field damping for the polarizable atoms.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_improper
metaInfos.description: Specifies the improper torsion potential of the MM system.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for NON-BONDED interactions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded14
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for 1-4 NON-BONDED interactions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded14_genpot
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for a generic potential type.A functional form is specified. Mathematical Operators recognized are +, -, *, /, ** or alternatively ^, whereas symbols for brackets must be (). The function parser recognizes the (single argument) Fortran 90 intrinsic functions abs, exp, log10, log, sqrt, sinh, cosh, tanh, sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan. Parsing for INTRINSIC functions is CASE INsensitive.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded14_goodwin
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for GOODWIN potential type.Functional form: V(r) = EXP(M*(-(r/DC)**MC+(D/DC)**MC))*VR0*(D/r)**M.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded14_lennard_jones
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for LENNARD-JONES potential type.Functional form: V(r) = 4.0 * EPSILON * [(SIGMA/r)^12-(SIGMA/r)^6].

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded14_williams
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for WILLIAMS potential type.Functional form: V(r) = A*EXP(-B*r) - C / r^6 .

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_bmhft
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for BMHFT potential type.Functional form: V(r) = A * EXP(-B*r) - C/r^6 - D/r^8.Values available inside cp2k only for the Na/Cl pair.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_bmhftd
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for BMHFTD potential type.Functional form: V(r) = A*exp(-B*r) - f_6*(r)C/r^6 - f_8(r)*D/r^8.where f_order(r)=1-exp(-BD * r) * \sum_{k=0}^order (BD * r)^k / k! .(Tang-Toennies damping function)No values available inside cp2k.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_buck4ranges
metaInfos.description:
This section specifies the input parameters for the Buckingham 4-ranges potential type. Functional form:
  • V(r) = A*EXP(-B*r) for r < r1
  • V(r) = Sum_n POLY1(n)*rn for r1 â¤ r < r2
  • V(r) = Sum_n POLY2(n)*rn for r2 â¤ r < r3
  • V(r) = -C/r6 for r â¥ r3

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_buckmorse
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for Buckingham plus Morse potential type  Functional Form: V(r) = F0*(B1+B2)*EXP([A1+A2-r]/[B1+B2])-C/r^6+D*{EXP[-2*beta*(r-R0)]-2*EXP[-beta*(r-R0)]}.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_eam
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for EAM potential type.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_genpot
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for a generic potential type.A functional form is specified. Mathematical Operators recognized are +, -, *, /, ** or alternatively ^, whereas symbols for brackets must be (). The function parser recognizes the (single argument) Fortran 90 intrinsic functions abs, exp, log10, log, sqrt, sinh, cosh, tanh, sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan. Parsing for INTRINSIC functions is CASE INsensitive.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_goodwin
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for GOODWIN potential type.Functional form: V(r) = EXP(M*(-(r/DC)**MC+(D/DC)**MC))*VR0*(D/r)**M.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_ipbv
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for IPBV potential type.Functional form: Implicit table function.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_lennard_jones
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for LENNARD-JONES potential type.Functional form: V(r) = 4.0 * EPSILON * [(SIGMA/r)^12-(SIGMA/r)^6].

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_quip
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for QUIP potential type. Mainly intended for things like GAP corrections to DFT to achieve correlated-wavefunction-like accuracy. Requires linking with quip library from http://www.libatoms.org .

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_siepmann
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for the Siepmann-Sprik potential type. Consist of 4 terms: T1+T2+T3+T4. The terms T1=A/rij^alpha and T2=-C/rij^6 have to be given via the GENPOT section. The terms T3+T4 are obtained from the SIEPMANN section.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_tersoff
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for Tersoff potential type.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_williams
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for WILLIAMS potential type.Functional form: V(r) = A*EXP(-B*r) - C / r^6 .

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_opbend
metaInfos.description: Specifies the out of plane bend potential of the MM system.(Only defined for atom quadruples which are also defined as an improper pattern in the topology.)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_quadrupole
metaInfos.description: This section specifies that we will perform an SCF quadrupole calculation of the MM atoms. Needs KEYWORD POL_SCF in POISSON secton

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_shell
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the parameters for shell-model potentials

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_spline
metaInfos.description: specifies parameters to set up the splines used in the nonboned interactions (both pair body potential and many body potential)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_torsion
metaInfos.description: Specifies the torsion potential of the MM system.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_neighbor_lists
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for the construction of neighbor lists.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson
metaInfos.description: Sets up the poisson resolutor.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald
metaInfos.description: Ewald parameters controlling electrostatic only for CLASSICAL MM.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_multipoles
metaInfos.description: Enables the use of multipoles in the treatment of the electrostatics.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_rs_grid
metaInfos.description: Set options that influence how the realspace grids are being distributed in parallel runs.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_mt
metaInfos.description: Sets up parameters of  Martyna-Tuckerman poisson solver. Note that exact results are only guaranteed if the unit cell is twice as large as charge density (and serious artefacts can result if the cell is much smaller).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_multipole
metaInfos.description: This section is used to set up the decoupling of QM periodic images with the use of density derived atomic point charges.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_multipole_check_spline
metaInfos.description: Controls the checking of the G-space term Spline Interpolation.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_multipole_interpolator
metaInfos.description: controls the interpolation for the G-space term

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_multipole_interpolator_conv_info
metaInfos.description: if convergence information about the linear solver of the spline methods should be printed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_multipole_program_run_info
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of basic information during the run

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_wavelet
metaInfos.description: Sets up parameters of  wavelet based poisson solver.This solver allows for non-periodic (PERIODIC NONE) boundary conditions and slab-boundary conditions (but only PERIODIC XZ).It does not require very large unit cells, only that the density goes to zero on the faces of the cell.The use of PREFERRED_FFT_LIBRARY FFTSG is required

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_print
metaInfos.description: Properties that you want to output and that are common to all methods

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_print_distribution
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of the distribution of molecules, atoms, ...

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_print_distribution1d
metaInfos.description: Each node prints out its distribution info ...

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_print_distribution1d_each
metaInfos.description: This section specifies how often this proprety is printed.Each keyword inside this section is mapping to a specific iteration level and the value of each of these keywords is matched with the iteration level during the calculation. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that each iteration level (MD, GEO_OPT, etc..), though equal to 0, might print the last iteration). If an iteration level is specified that is not present in the flow of the calculation it is just ignored.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_print_distribution2d
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of the distribution of matrix blocks,...

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_properties_resp
metaInfos.description: Requests a RESP fit of charges. When using a periodic Poisson solver and a periodic cell, the periodic RESP routines are used. If the Hartree potential matches with the one of an isolated system (i.e. isolated Poisson solver and big, nonperiodic cells), the nonperiodic RESP routines are automatically used. The subsections NONPERIODIC_SYS and PERIODIC_SYS do not request a nonperiodic or periodic solution, they only determine the sampling of the fitting points. All restraints are harmonic!

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_properties_resp_constraint
metaInfos.description: specifies a linear constraint on the fitted charges.This can be used to give equal values to equivalent atoms.sum over atom_list c_i * q_i = t

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_properties_resp_nonperiodic_sys
metaInfos.description: Specifies the parameter for sampling the RESP fitting points for non-periodic systems, i.e. systems that do not involve surfaces. This section can be used with periodic and nonperiodic Poisson solvers, it only affects the sampling of grid points. All grid points in the shell defined by rmin and rmax are accepted for fitting.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_properties_resp_periodic_sys
metaInfos.description: Specifies the parameter for sampling the RESP fitting points for periodic systems, i.e. systems that involve surfaces. This section can only be used with periodic  Poisson solver and cell. To see, which grid points were used, switch on COORD_FIT_POINTS in the PRINT section.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_properties_resp_restraint
metaInfos.description: specifies a restraint on the fitted charges.This can be used to restrain values to zero.s*(sum over atom_list q_i - t)**2

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm
metaInfos.description: Input for QM/MM calculations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell
metaInfos.description: Input parameters needed to set up the CELL.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_cell_ref
metaInfos.description: Input parameters needed to set up the CELL_REF.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing
metaInfos.description: This section enables and defines parameters for force-mixing based QM/MM, which actually does two conventional QM/MM calculations, on a small  and a large QM region, and combines the MM forces from one and QM  forces from the other to create a complete set of forces.  Energy is  not conserved (although the QM/MM energy from the large QM region calculation is reported)  so a proper thermostat (i.e. massive, and able to handle dissipation, such as  Adaptive Langevin (AD_LANGEVIN)) must be used. For some propagation algorithms  (NVT and REFTRAJ MD ensembles) algorithm is adaptive,  including molecules hysteretically based on their instantaneous distance from the core region.  Information on core/QM/buffer labels can be written in PDB file using  MOTION&PRINT&FORCE_MIXING_LABELS.  Will fail if calculation requires a  meaningfull stress, or an energy that is consistent with the forces.  For GEO_OPT this means  only MOTION&GEO_OPT&TYPE CG, MOTION&GEO_OPT&CG&LINE_SEARCH&TYPE 2PNT, and  MOTION&GEO_OPT&CG&LINE_SEARCH&2PNT&LINMIN_GRAD_ONLY T

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing_buffer_links
metaInfos.description: Information about possible links for automatic covalent bond breaking for the buffer QM/MM calculation.Ignored - need to implement buffer selection by atom and walking of connectivity data.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_forcefield_nonbonded14
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for 1-4 NON-BONDED interactions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_forcefield_nonbonded14_genpot
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for a generic potential type.A functional form is specified. Mathematical Operators recognized are +, -, *, /, ** or alternatively ^, whereas symbols for brackets must be (). The function parser recognizes the (single argument) Fortran 90 intrinsic functions abs, exp, log10, log, sqrt, sinh, cosh, tanh, sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan. Parsing for INTRINSIC functions is CASE INsensitive.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_forcefield_nonbonded14_goodwin
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for GOODWIN potential type.Functional form: V(r) = EXP(M*(-(r/DC)**MC+(D/DC)**MC))*VR0*(D/r)**M.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_forcefield_nonbonded14_lennard_jones
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for LENNARD-JONES potential type.Functional form: V(r) = 4.0 * EPSILON * [(SIGMA/r)^12-(SIGMA/r)^6].

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_forcefield_nonbonded14_williams
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for WILLIAMS potential type.Functional form: V(r) = A*EXP(-B*r) - C / r^6 .

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_forcefield_nonbonded_genpot
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for a generic potential type.A functional form is specified. Mathematical Operators recognized are +, -, *, /, ** or alternatively ^, whereas symbols for brackets must be (). The function parser recognizes the (single argument) Fortran 90 intrinsic functions abs, exp, log10, log, sqrt, sinh, cosh, tanh, sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan. Parsing for INTRINSIC functions is CASE INsensitive.

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for GOODWIN potential type.Functional form: V(r) = EXP(M*(-(r/DC)**MC+(D/DC)**MC))*VR0*(D/r)**M.

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for WILLIAMS potential type.Functional form: V(r) = A*EXP(-B*r) - C / r^6 .

metaInfos.description: Sets up parameters of  wavelet based poisson solver.This solver allows for non-periodic (PERIODIC NONE) boundary conditions and slab-boundary conditions (but only PERIODIC XZ).It does not require very large unit cells, only that the density goes to zero on the faces of the cell.The use of PREFERRED_FFT_LIBRARY FFTSG is required

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_torsion_point
metaInfos.description: Enables the possibility to use geometrical centers instead of single atoms to define colvars

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_u
metaInfos.description: Section to define the energy as a generalized collective variable.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_u_mixed
metaInfos.description: This section allows to use any function of the energy subsystems  in a mixed_env calculation as a collective variable.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_wc
metaInfos.description: Section to define the hbond wannier centre as a collective variables.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_wc_point
metaInfos.description: Enables the possibility to use geometrical centers instead of single atoms to define colvars

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_xyz_diag
metaInfos.description: Section to define the distance of an atom from its starting position ((X-X(0))^2+(Y-Y(0))^2+(Z-Z(0))^2) or part of its components as a collective variable.If absolute_position is specified, instead the CV is represented by the instantaneous position of the atom (only available for X, Y or Z components).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_xyz_diag_point
metaInfos.description: Enables the possibility to use geometrical centers instead of single atoms to define colvars

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_xyz_outerdiag
metaInfos.description: Section to define the cross term (XA-XA(0))*(XB-XB(0))+(XA-XA(0))*(YB-YB(0)) or part of its components as a collective variable. The final term is given by the product  of the components of A with the components of B.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_xyz_outerdiag_point
metaInfos.description: Enables the possibility to use geometrical centers instead of single atoms to define colvars

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_coord
metaInfos.description: The coordinates for simple systems (like the QM ones) xyz format by default. More complex systems should be given with an external pdb file.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_core_coord
metaInfos.description: The core coordinates for the shell-model potentials xyz format with an additional column for the index of the corresponding particle

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_core_velocity
metaInfos.description: The velocities of cores for shell-model potentials, in xyz format

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_kind
metaInfos.description: The description of the kind of the atoms (mostly for QM)

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_basis
metaInfos.description: Section used to specify a general basis set for QM calculations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_bs
metaInfos.description: Define the required atomic orbital occupation assigned in initialization of the density matrix, by adding or subtracting electrons from specific angular momentum channels. It works only with GUESS ATOMIC.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_bs_alpha
metaInfos.description: alpha spin

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_bs_beta
metaInfos.description: beta spin

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_dft_plus_u
metaInfos.description: Define the parameters for a DFT+U run

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_dft_plus_u_enforce_occupation
metaInfos.description: Enforce and control a special (initial) orbital occupation. Note, this feature works only for the methods MULLIKEN and LOWDIN. It should only be used to prepare an initial configuration. An inadequate parameter choice can easily inhibit SCF convergence.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_geminal
metaInfos.description: Section used to specify a geminal basis set for QM calculations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_kg_potential
metaInfos.description: Section used to specify KG Potentials.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_potential
metaInfos.description: Section used to specify Potentials.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_multipoles
metaInfos.description: Specifies the dipoles and quadrupoles for particles.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_multipoles_dipoles
metaInfos.description: Specifies the dipoles of the particles.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_multipoles_quadrupoles
metaInfos.description: Specifies the quadrupoles of the particles.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_rng_init
metaInfos.description: Information to initialize the parallel random number generator streams

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_shell_coord
metaInfos.description: The shell coordinates for the shell-model potentials xyz format with an additional column for the index of the corresponding particle

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_shell_velocity
metaInfos.description: The velocities of shells for shell-model potentials, in xyz format

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology
metaInfos.description: Section specifying information regarding how to handle the topology for classical runs.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_center_coordinates
metaInfos.description: Allows centering the coordinates of the system in the box. The centering point can be defined by the user.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_pdb
metaInfos.description: controls the dumping of the PDB at the starting geometry

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_dump_psf
metaInfos.description: controls the dumping of the PSF connectivity

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_exclude_ei_list
metaInfos.description: Speficy bonds (via atom kinds) for fine tuning of 1-2 exclusion lists. If this section is not present the 1-2 exclusion is applied to all bond kinds. When this section is present the 1-2 exclusion is applied ONLY to the bonds defined herein. This section allows ONLY fine tuning of 1-2 interactions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_exclude_vdw_list
metaInfos.description: Speficy bonds (via atom kinds) for fine tuning of 1-2 exclusion lists. If this section is not present the 1-2 exclusion is applied to all bond kinds. When this section is present the 1-2 exclusion is applied ONLY to the bonds defined herein. This section allows ONLY fine tuning of 1-2 interactions.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate
metaInfos.description: Setup of keywords controlling the generation of the connectivity

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_angle
metaInfos.description: Section used to add/remove angles in the connectivity. Useful for systems with a complex connectivity, difficult to find out automatically.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_bond
metaInfos.description: Section used to add/remove  bonds in the connectivity. Useful for systems with a complex connectivity, difficult to find out automatically.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_improper
metaInfos.description: Section used to add/remove improper in the connectivity. Useful for systems with a complex connectivity, difficult to find out automatically.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_isolated_atoms
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the  atoms that one considers isolated. Useful when present  ions in solution.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_neighbor_lists
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for the construction of neighbor lists.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_generate_torsion
metaInfos.description: Section used to add/remove torsion in the connectivity. Useful for systems with a complex connectivity, difficult to find out automatically.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set
metaInfos.description: Specify the connectivity of a full system specifying the connectivity of the fragments of the system.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_merge_molecules
metaInfos.description: Enables the creation of connecting bridges (bonds, angles, torsions, impropers) between the two or more molecules defined with independent connectivity.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_merge_molecules_angles
metaInfos.description: Defines new angles

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_merge_molecules_bonds
metaInfos.description: Defines new bonds

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_merge_molecules_impropers
metaInfos.description: Defines new impropers

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_merge_molecules_torsions
metaInfos.description: Defines new torsions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_mol_set_molecule
metaInfos.description: Specify information about the connectivity of single molecules

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_subsys_velocity
metaInfos.description: The velocities for simple systems or the centroid mode in PI runs, xyz format by default

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_global
metaInfos.description: Section with general information regarding which kind of simulation to perform an parameters for the whole PROGRAM

metaInfos.description: Configuration options for the DBCSR library.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_global_dbcsr_acc
metaInfos.description: Configuration options for the ACC-Driver.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_global_fm
metaInfos.description: Configuration options for the full matrices.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_global_machine_arch
metaInfos.description: Configuration options for the machine architecture.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_global_program_run_info
metaInfos.description: controls the printing of  initialization controlled by the global section

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_global_references
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of the references relevant to the calculations performed

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_global_timings
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of the timing report at the end of CP2K execution

metaInfos.description: Activate the DIIS based optimization procedure for BAND

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_band_optimize_band_diis_diis_info
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of diis info during a BAND run

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md
metaInfos.description: Activate the MD based optimization procedure for BAND

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_temp_control

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_band_optimize_band_md_vel_control
metaInfos.description: Setup parameters to control the velocity during a BAND MD run.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_band_program_run_info
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing basic info about the BAND run

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_band_replica
metaInfos.description: Specify coordinates and velocities (possibly) of the replica

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_band_replica_coord
metaInfos.description: The positions for BAND used for restart

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_band_replica_info
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of each replica info during a BAND run

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_band_replica_velocity
metaInfos.description: The velocities for BAND used for restart

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_cell_opt
metaInfos.description: This section sets the environment for the optimization of the simulation cell. Two possible schemes are available: (1) Zero temperature optimization;  (2) Finite temperature optimization.

metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the BFGS optimization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_restart
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of Hessian Restart file

metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the conjugate gradient optimization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search
metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the line search during the conjugate gradient optimization

metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the line search for the two point based line search.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_gold
metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the line search for the gold search.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_cell_opt_lbfgs
metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the limited memory BFGS (LBFGS) optimization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint
metaInfos.description: Section specifying information regarding how to impose constraints on the system.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_collective
metaInfos.description: Used to constraint collective (general) degrees of freedom, writing langrangian multipliers to file.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_collective_restraint
metaInfos.description: Activate and specify information on restraint instead of constraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_colvar_restart
metaInfos.description: Specify restart position only for COLVAR restraints.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_constraint_info
metaInfos.description: Prints information about iterative constraints solutions

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_fix_atom_restart
metaInfos.description: Specify restart position only for FIXED_ATOMS restraints.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_fixed_atoms
metaInfos.description: This section is used to constraint the overall atomic position (X,Y,Z). In case a restraint is specified the value of the TARGET is considered to be the value of the coordinates at the beginning of the run or alternatively the corresponding value in the section: FIX_ATOM_RESTART.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_fixed_atoms_restraint
metaInfos.description: Activate and specify information on restraint instead of constraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_g3x3
metaInfos.description: This section is used to set 3x3 (3 atoms and 3 distances) constraints.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_g3x3_restraint
metaInfos.description: Activate and specify information on restraint instead of constraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_g4x6
metaInfos.description: This section is used to set 4x6 (4 atoms and 6 distances) constraints.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_g4x6_restraint
metaInfos.description: Activate and specify information on restraint instead of constraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_hbonds
metaInfos.description: This section is used to set bonds constraints involving Hydrogen atoms

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_hbonds_restraint
metaInfos.description: Activate and specify information on restraint instead of constraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_lagrange_multipliers
metaInfos.description: Prints out the lagrange multipliers of the specified constraints during an MD.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_virtual_site
metaInfos.description: This section is used to set a virtual interaction-site constraint.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_constraint_virtual_site_restraint
metaInfos.description: Activate and specify information on restraint instead of constraint

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_driver
metaInfos.description: This section defines the parameters needed to run in i-PI driver mode.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_flexible_partitioning
metaInfos.description: This section sets up flexible_partitioning

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_flexible_partitioning_control
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of FP info at startup

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_flexible_partitioning_weights
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of FP info during flexible partitioning simulations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy
metaInfos.description: Controls the calculation of free energy and free energy derivatives with different possible methods

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_alchemical_change
metaInfos.description: Controls the calculation of delta free energies with the alchemical change method.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_free_energy_info
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of basic and summary information during the Free Energy calculation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn
metaInfos.description: This section sets parameters to set up a calculation of metadynamics.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_ext_lagrange_fs
metaInfos.description: Colvar force within an extended Lagrangian formalism.Used for RESTART.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_ext_lagrange_ss
metaInfos.description: Colvar Theta within an extended Lagrangian formalism.Used for RESTART.

metaInfos.description: Colvar position within an extended Lagrangian formalism.Used for RESTART.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_ext_lagrange_vvp
metaInfos.description: Colvar velocities within an extended Lagrangian formalism.Used for RESTART.

metaInfos.description: This section specify the nature of the collective variables.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall
metaInfos.description: Controls the activation of walls on COLVAR during a metadynamic run.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_gaussian
metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the gaussian wall.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_quadratic
metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the quadratic wall

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_quartic
metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the quartic wall

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_reflective
metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the reflective wall

metaInfos.description: Enables and configures the metadynamics using multiple walkers.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_multiple_walkers_walkers_file_name
metaInfos.description: Specify the basename for the NUMBER_OF_WALKERS files used to communicate between the walkers. Absolute path can be input as well together with the filename. One file will be created for each spawned hill.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_spawned_hills_height
metaInfos.description: The height of the spawned hills during metadynamics.Used for RESTART.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_spawned_hills_invdt
metaInfos.description: The inverse of the DELTA_T parameter used for Well-Tempered metadynamics.Used for RESTART.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_spawned_hills_pos
metaInfos.description: The position of the spawned hills during metadynamics.Used for RESTART.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_spawned_hills_scale
metaInfos.description: The scales of the spawned hills during metadynamics.Used for RESTART. When a scale is zero in one or more directions, the Gaussian hill is assumed to be infinitely wide in those directions. The latter can be used to combine spawned hills from multiple 1D metadynamics runs in one multidimensional metadynamics run.
