metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_md_langevin
metaInfos.description: Controls the set of parameters to run a Langevin MD. The integrator used follows that given in the article by Ricci et al. The user can define regions in the system where the atoms inside undergoes Langevin MD, while those outside the regions undergoes NVE Born Oppenheimer MD. To define the regions, the user should use THERMAL_REGION subsection of MOTION%MD. The theory for Langevin MD involving sub-regions can be found in articles by Kantorovitch et al. All the references can be found in the links below.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_md_msst
metaInfos.description: Parameters for Multi-Scale Shock Technique (MSST) which simulate the effect of a steady planar shock on a unit cell. Reed et. al. Physical Review Letters 90, 235503 (2003).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_md_respa
metaInfos.description: Multiple timestep integration based on RESPA (implemented for NVE only). RESPA exploits multiple force_eval. In this case the order of the force_eval maps  the order of the respa shells from the slowest to the fastest force evaluation. If force_evals share the same subsys, it's enough then to specify the  subsys in the force_eval corresponding at the first index in the multiple_force_eval list. Can be used to speedup classical and ab initio MD simulations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_md_thermal_region
metaInfos.description: Define regions where different initialization and control of the temperature is used. When MOTION%MD%ENSEMBLE is set to LANGEVIN, this section controls if the atoms defined inside and outside the thermal regions should undergo Langevin MD or NVE Born-Oppenheimer MD. The theory behind Langevin MD using different regions can be found in articles by Kantorovitch et al. listed below.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_md_velocity_softening
metaInfos.description: A method to initialize the velocities along low-curvature directions in order to favors MD trajectories to cross rapidly over small energy barriers into neighboring basins. In each iteration the forces are calculated at a point y, which is slightly displaced from the current positions x in the direction of the original velocities v. The velocities are then updated with the force component F_t, which is perpendicular to N. N = v / |v|;  y = x + delta * N;  F_t = F(y) - â© F(y) | N âª * N; v' = v + alpha * F_t

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_print_cell
metaInfos.description: Controls the output of the simulation cell. For later analysis of the trajectory it is recommendable that the frequency of printing is the same as the one used for the trajectory file.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_print_cell_each
metaInfos.description: This section specifies how often this proprety is printed.Each keyword inside this section is mapping to a specific iteration level and the value of each of these keywords is matched with the iteration level during the calculation. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that each iteration level (MD, GEO_OPT, etc..), though equal to 0, might print the last iteration). If an iteration level is specified that is not present in the flow of the calculation it is just ignored.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_print_shell_trajectory_each
metaInfos.description: This section specifies how often this proprety is printed.Each keyword inside this section is mapping to a specific iteration level and the value of each of these keywords is matched with the iteration level during the calculation. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that each iteration level (MD, GEO_OPT, etc..), though equal to 0, might print the last iteration). If an iteration level is specified that is not present in the flow of the calculation it is just ignored.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_shell_opt
metaInfos.description: This section sets the environment for the optimization of the shell-core distances that might turn to be necessary along a MD run using a shell-model potential.  The optimization procedure is activated when at least one of the shell-core pairs becomes too elongated,  i.e. when the assumption of point dipole is not longer valid.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_shell_opt_bfgs
metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the BFGS optimization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_shell_opt_bfgs_restart
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of Hessian Restart file

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_shell_opt_cg
metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the conjugate gradient optimization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search
metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the line search during the conjugate gradient optimization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_2pnt
metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the line search for the two point based line search.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_gold
metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the line search for the gold search.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_shell_opt_lbfgs
metaInfos.description: Provides parameters to tune the limited memory BFGS (LBFGS) optimization

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_tmc
metaInfos.description: A parallelized MC algorithm, presampling the configurations, espacially the Markov chain elements

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_tmc_move_type
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the TMC move type, and its properties. Selectable types are: ATOM_TRANS atom translation, MOL_TRANS molecule translation, MOL_ROT molecule rotation, PROT_REORDER proton reordering, PT_SWAP Parallel Tempering swap, VOL_MOVE volume change, ATOM_SWAP swaps two atoms of different type.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_tmc_nmc_moves
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the TMC move types, which are performed within the nested Monte Carlo (NMC). thus using the approximate potential.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_tmc_nmc_moves_move_type
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the TMC move type, and its properties. Selectable types are: ATOM_TRANS atom translation, MOL_TRANS molecule translation, MOL_ROT molecule rotation, PROT_REORDER proton reordering, PT_SWAP Parallel Tempering swap, VOL_MOVE volume change, ATOM_SWAP swaps two atoms of different type.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_tmc_tmc_analysis
metaInfos.description: Analysing the Markov Chain elments with the specified methods

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_tmc_tmc_analysis_charge
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the charge of the MM atoms

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_tmc_tmc_analysis_files
metaInfos.description: Analysing the Markov Chain elments with the specified methods, reading form default or specified files

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_tmc_tmc_analysis_files_charge
metaInfos.description: This section specifies the charge of the MM atoms

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_multiple_force_evals
metaInfos.description: Describes how to handle multiple force_evals.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_basis
metaInfos.description: describes a basis optimization job, in which an ADMM like approach is used to find the best exponents and/or coefficients to match a given training set.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind
metaInfos.description: specicifies the atomic kinds to be fitted and the basis sets associated with the kind.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_constrain_exponents
metaInfos.description: specicifies contraints for the exponents to be fitted. Only a single constraint can be applied to an exponent

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_derived_basis_sets
metaInfos.description: This section can be used to create subsets of a basis  which will be fitted at the same time. This is especially useful if connected bsis sets e.g. TZVP, DZVP, SZV should be fitted.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_basis_optimization
metaInfos.description: sets the parameters for optimizition, output frequency and restarts

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_basis_training_files
metaInfos.description: specicifies the location in which the files necessary for fitting procedure are located. Each Training set needs a reptition of this section.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_input
metaInfos.description: describes an input optimization job, in which parameters in input files get optimized.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_input_force_matching
metaInfos.description: Specify the force matching input.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_input_force_matching_compare_energies
metaInfos.description: A comparison of energies between fit and reference

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_input_force_matching_compare_forces
metaInfos.description: A comparison of forces between fit and reference

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_input_history
metaInfos.description: writes a history of the function value and parameters

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_input_restart
metaInfos.description: writes an input file that can be used to restart

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_optimize_input_variable
metaInfos.description: Defines initial values for variables and their labels

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_swarm
metaInfos.description: Section to control swarm runs. The swarm framework provides a common ground for master/worker algorithms.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_swarm_global_opt
metaInfos.description: Section to control global geometry optimizations.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_swarm_global_opt_history
metaInfos.description: Section controling the history of visited minima and how minima are recognized at a later point.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_swarm_global_opt_minima_crawling
metaInfos.description: Section controls Minima Crawling run.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_swarm_global_opt_minima_crawling_minima_trajectory
metaInfos.description: Printkey to controll the writting of the minima trajectory. This trajectory contains all encountered local minima.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_swarm_global_opt_minima_hopping
metaInfos.description: Section controlling the Minima Hopping method.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_swarm_global_opt_progress_trajectory
metaInfos.description: Printkey to controll the writting of the progress trajectory. This trajectory contains the minima, which are lower in energy than the by then lowerest.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_test
metaInfos.description: Tests to perform on the supported libraries.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_test_cp_dbcsr
metaInfos.description: Benchmark and test the cp_dbcsr routines

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_test_cp_fm_gemm
metaInfos.description: Benchmark and test the cp_fm_gemm routines by multiplying C=A*B

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_test_eigensolver
metaInfos.description: Benchmark and test the eigensolver routines.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_test_grid_information
metaInfos.description: Controls the printing of information regarding the PW and RS grid structures (ONLY for TEST run).

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_test_program_run_info
metaInfos.description: controls the printing of tests output

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_test_pw_transfer
metaInfos.description: Benchmark and test the pw_transfer routines.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_test_rs_pw_transfer
metaInfos.description: Describes how to benchmark the rs_pw_transfer routines.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_test_rs_pw_transfer_rs_grid
metaInfos.description: Set options that influence how the realspace grids are being distributed in parallel runs.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_vibrational_analysis
metaInfos.description: Section to setup parameters to perform a Normal Modes analysis.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_vibrational_analysis_mode_selective
metaInfos.description: All parameters needed for to run a mode selective vibrational analysis

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_vibrational_analysis_mode_selective_involved_atoms
metaInfos.description: All parameters needed for the tracking of modes dominated by the motion of selected atoms
